candidates.title_1: Thermalization in classical systems with discrete phase space
candidates.title_2: Numerical stationary states for nonlocal Fokker-Planck equations via fixed points of consistency maps
candidates.mechanism_1: Local ergodicity in subsystems, rather than global ergodicity, enables thermalization. Subsystem dynamics appear pseudorandom due to local interactions. Statistical properties of observables emerge from this effective local randomization without requiring the entire system to be ergodic.
candidates.mechanism_2: Stationary states (both stable and unstable) are computed via fixed-point iteration of a consistency map derived from the PDE and nonlocal interactions. The method is agnostic to dynamical stability—detecting equilibria regardless of whether they attract or repel trajectories. This separates statics (equilibrium existence) from dynamics (stability), enabling discovery of unstable stationary configurations invisible to time-evolution methods.

candidates.title_1: Analytical and numerical study of a parametrically excited 2DOF oscillator with nonlinear restoring magnetic force and rotating rectangular rod
candidates.title_2: Plasticity, hysteresis, and recovery mechanisms in spider silk fibers
candidates.mechanism_1: Time-periodic stiffness variation induces parametric excitation in coupled components. Nonlinear restoring forces and friction interact to produce a spectrum of dynamic responses including periodic, quasi-periodic, and chaotic behaviors. System parameters (stiffness degree, mass symmetry, friction) determine stability boundaries and response amplitude.
candidates.mechanism_2: Parallel networks with distinct failure modes enable large reversible deformations: brittle bond network governs initial stiffness and yield point, entropic elastic network enables large deformations post-yield; reorganization and rebonding during recovery locks new equilibrium with increased stiffness.

candidates.title_1: Chaotic Dynamics in Extremal Black Holes: A Challenge to the Chaos Bound
candidates.title_2: Emergence and co-existence of periodic and unstructured motion in future-avoiding random walks
candidates.mechanism_1: Particle motion in extremal configurations exhibits positive Lyapunov exponents indicating sensitivity to initial conditions. Chaos persists even at zero temperature. System parameters (spin, charge) modulate chaos strength - increasing one parameter strengthens chaotic behavior while the other weakens it.
candidates.mechanism_2: Self-amplifying coupling to periodic components of stochastic forcing drives phase transition from unstructured to structured behavior: weak periodic signals in noise become amplified through positive feedback, spontaneously synchronizing system components.

candidates.title_1: Indirect Reciprocity with Environmental Feedback
candidates.title_2: Emulating Aggregate Human Choice Behavior and Biases with GPT Conversational Agents
candidates.mechanism_1: Individual behaviors shape reputation through social norms while simultaneously affecting collective resource levels. Environmental changes alter payoff structures, creating feedback between strategic behavior and resource dynamics. Reputation-based cooperation interacts with ecological constraints - cooperative behaviors deplete or enhance shared resources, which then reshape the incentives for future cooperation.
candidates.mechanism_2: Cognitive biases shape decision-making through interaction with contextual factors. When cognitive load increases (complex dialogue), pre-existing biases amplify through reduced deliberative capacity. The bias magnitude is context-dependent: simple interactions suppress bias expression, while complex interactions magnify it by consuming cognitive resources that would otherwise moderate biased responses.

candidates.title_1: Phase Dynamics of Self-Accelerating Bose-Einstein Condensates
candidates.title_2: On the occupation measure of evolution models with vanishing mutations
candidates.mechanism_1: Self-accelerating matter waves exhibit cubic phase evolution. Weak mean-field nonlinearities cause linear response in cubic coefficient - interaction strength directly modulates phase curvature. Phase extraction from interference patterns reveals nonlinearity effects through systematic windowed polynomial fitting accounting for window correlations.
candidates.mechanism_2: Collective oscillations in many-body systems mediate nonlinear wave mixing without requiring strong single-particle nonlinearity. Coherent many-body response creates effective nonlinearity through collective mode coupling. Weak individual interactions amplified by collective dynamics generate strong wave mixing. Effective interaction strength scales with system size or coupling density.

candidates.title_1: From Discrete to Continuous Mixed Populations of Conformists, Nonconformists, and Imitators
candidates.title_2: On the Uncertainty of Large Language Model-Based Multi-Agent Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Three behavioral types interact: conformists benefit from choosing common strategies, nonconformists profit from rare strategies, and imitators copy highest earners. Population proportions fluctuate in finite populations but equilibrate as population size increases. Strategy proportions undergo perpetual oscillations in small populations, but fluctuation amplitudes approach zero in large populations through stochastic averaging.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multi-agent performance is governed by certainty preference: reducing entropy at any stage for any agent is critical for correct solutions. Uncertainty dynamics are largely determined in the first interaction round, establishing baseline entropy that constrains subsequent evolution. Lower base model entropy during initial problem-solving directly benefits multi-agent outcomes, suggesting initial uncertainty sets persistent constraints on collaborative effectiveness.

candidates.title_1: Graph-Based Audits for Meek Single Transferable Vote Elections
candidates.title_2: Decaying Sensitivity of the Zero Solution for a Class of Nonlinear Optimal Control Problems
candidates.mechanism_1: Constraining process trajectories to fixed subgraph of possibility space enables efficient verification without full enumeration: defining acceptable path subgraph and verifying containment cheaper than exploring all possibilities.
candidates.mechanism_2: Localized perturbations in graph-structured systems induce optimal trajectories that decay exponentially with graph distance from perturbation source. Spatial decay arises from interaction topology: influences propagate through network edges but attenuate geometrically with path length. Graph distance acts as effective spatial dimension governing perturbation propagation, with topology imposing decay rate independently of detailed dynamics.

candidates.title_1: From Assumptions to Actions: Turning LLM Reasoning into Uncertainty-Aware Planning for Embodied Agents
candidates.title_2: ProbFM: Probabilistic Time Series Foundation Model with Uncertainty Decomposition
candidates.mechanism_1: Latent assumptions in reasoning traces are converted into structured action space through decision tree mapping. Each tree path encodes environment assumptions (internal nodes) linked to action sequences (leaves), scored by scenario likelihood, goal utility, and execution cost. Uncertainty is handled by exploring assumption-action mappings rather than eliminating uncertainty through communication, transforming fragmented beliefs into rational action selection.
candidates.mechanism_2: Deep Evidential Regression decomposes uncertainty into epistemic (model uncertainty) and aleatoric (data noise) components through higher-order evidence learning. Rather than pre-specifying distributions or requiring sampling, the model learns optimal uncertainty representations by treating prediction as distribution over distributions. Single-pass inference yields explicit epistemic-aleatoric separation, enabling principled uncertainty quantification without additional computational cost.

candidates.title_1: From semantic memory to collective creativity: A generative cognitive foundation for social creativity models
candidates.title_2: GenAI-Net: A Generative AI Framework for Automated Biomolecular Network Design
candidates.mechanism_1: Individual semantic network topology determines ideational breadth. When agents exchange ideation traces, lower initial overlap predicts larger stimulation gains. Shared inspiration sources create network-level redundancy, forming feedback between individual cognitive structure and collective outcomes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Biomolecular network design reverses the typical simulation workflow: instead of checking proposed networks, an agent proposes reactions guided by behavioral specification. Coupling generative proposal with simulation-based evaluation (user-specified objective) produces topologically diverse solutions. The generative component explores reaction space, while simulation evaluates functional fit, enabling automated discovery of networks implementing desired dynamics from specifications.

candidates.title_1: Heterogeneity dominates irreversibility in random Markov models
candidates.title_2: PhysicsAgentABM: Physics-Guided Generative Agent-Based Modeling
candidates.mechanism_1: Markov dynamics combine heterogeneity and asymmetry (broken detailed balance). Heterogeneity parameter controls transition rate variability. Asymmetry parameter controls forward-backward correlation. Critical locus emerges where relaxation times diverge. Entropy production and predictive information depend strongly on heterogeneity but weakly on asymmetry. Near criticality, small heterogeneity changes cause large dynamical shifts.
candidates.mechanism_2: Population-level inference with uncertainty-aware fusion decouples global dynamics from individual variability: clustering behaviorally similar entities, encoding mechanistic priors, and fusing uncertain predictions at cluster level enables scalable simulation.

candidates.title_1: Online Fine-Tuning of Pretrained Controllers for Autonomous Driving via Real-Time Recurrent RL
candidates.title_2: Minimal-Action Discrete Schrödinger Bridge Matching for Peptide Sequence Design
candidates.mechanism_1: Online recurrent learning continuously adapts pretrained policies to environmental drift and task changes: biologically-plausible real-time weight updates enable deployed systems to maintain performance under non-stationary conditions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Controlled transport relative to informed reference process yields low-action paths through high-likelihood regions: defining generation as deviation from biologically-informed baseline keeps intermediate states plausible throughout trajectory.

candidates.title_1: The impact of heterogeneity on the co-evolution of cooperation and epidemic spreading in complex networks
candidates.title_2: On the Uncertainty of Large Language Model-Based Multi-Agent Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Cooperation and disease transmission coevolve through network structure. Structural heterogeneity creates leverage points - highly connected hubs adopt protection due to amplified risk, catalyzing cooperation. Cost heterogeneity creates weakest links - low-risk individuals free-ride and act as disease reservoirs, undermining cooperation. Heterogeneity is double-edged: influence asymmetry facilitates cooperation, motivation asymmetry degrades it.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multi-agent performance is governed by certainty preference: reducing entropy at any stage for any agent is critical for correct solutions. Uncertainty dynamics are largely determined in the first interaction round, establishing baseline entropy that constrains subsequent evolution. Lower base model entropy during initial problem-solving directly benefits multi-agent outcomes, suggesting initial uncertainty sets persistent constraints on collaborative effectiveness.

candidates.title_1: An Adaptive Differentially Private Federated Learning Framework with Bi-level Optimization
candidates.title_2: Non-Stationary Inventory Control with Lead Times
candidates.mechanism_1: Local compressed module regularizes representations to constrain gradient variability, mitigating noise amplification in heterogeneous federated learning. Adaptive gradient clipping dynamically adjusts thresholds based on historical statistics to avoid over-clipping. Constraint-aware aggregation suppresses unreliable noise-dominated updates, stabilizing global optimization under differential privacy.
candidates.mechanism_2: Systems with delayed feedback combined with censored observations face fundamental learning limitations compared to systems with immediate uncensored feedback, creating a sharp performance separation even with identical optimization algorithms.

candidates.title_1: Pairwise is Not Enough: Hypergraph Neural Networks for Multi-Agent Pathfinding
candidates.title_2: Decaying Sensitivity of the Zero Solution for a Class of Nonlinear Optimal Control Problems
candidates.mechanism_1: Hypergraph attention captures group (beyond pairwise) coordination dynamics in multi-agent pathfinding. Standard GNNs limited to pairwise message passing suffer attention dilution in dense environments where group coordination is critical. Attentional mechanisms over directed hypergraphs explicitly model higher-order interactions, mitigating representational bottleneck and enabling complex coordination where pairwise methods fail.
candidates.mechanism_2: Localized perturbations in graph-structured systems induce optimal trajectories that decay exponentially with graph distance from perturbation source. Spatial decay arises from interaction topology: influences propagate through network edges but attenuate geometrically with path length. Graph distance acts as effective spatial dimension governing perturbation propagation, with topology imposing decay rate independently of detailed dynamics.

candidates.title_1: Imperfect molecular detection renormalizes apparent kinetic rates in stochastic gene regulatory networks
candidates.title_2: Locally Gentle State Certification for High Dimensional Quantum Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Imperfect molecular detection in single-cell measurements introduces technical noise obscuring true dynamics. Binomial capture models describe detection inefficiency. Under high transcription factor abundance or timescale separation, capture effects renormalize kinetic rates. Apparent mean burst size appears reduced while binding reactions appear faster. Technical noise reshapes observed statistics without changing underlying mechanism - creates measurement-induced effective parameters.
candidates.mechanism_2: Measurement gentleness constraint (α-bounded state perturbation) imposes information extraction penalty. Sample complexity scales as d/α² - the trade-off between disturbance and information parallels privacy mechanisms. Gentler measurements require more samples but preserve quantum state for reuse, creating fundamental efficiency-preservation trade-off.

candidates.title_1: Cross-feeding yields high-dimensional chaos and coexistence of species beyond exclusion principle
candidates.title_2: Low-Dimensional Interaction Spaces Impose Geometric Constraints On Collective Organization
candidates.mechanism_1: Species cross-feed through metabolite leakage and uptake. Competitive uptake of leaked chemicals creates coupled population-chemical dynamics. Network structure determines attractor types: fixed points, limit cycles, low-dimensional chaos, or high-dimensional chaos. High-dimensional chaos enables coexistence beyond competitive exclusion limits through intermittent switching among quasi-stationary states. Chemical dynamics explore high-dimensional space while populations switch intermittently.
candidates.mechanism_2: When effective interactions among system components compress into low-dimensional interaction space, global organization is governed by geometric constraints rather than detailed dynamics. Low interaction dimensionality imposes upper bounds on number, separability, and robustness of collective organizations. Many macroscopic organizations are excluded a priori even when locally-compatible interactions exist, shifting explanation from generative mechanisms to structural impossibility.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: Noisy nonlocal aggregation model with gradient flow structures
candidates.mechanism_1: As a system approaches a bifurcation point, convergence to steady state slows dramatically. Near criticality, relaxation time diverges according to universal scaling laws. The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Stochastic perturbations in nonlocal aggregation systems create gradient-flow structure in Wasserstein space. Noise regulates density and prevents singular concentration through equilibrium states from constrained energy minimization. Stable energy minimizers emerge from interplay between potential-driven interactions and environmental variability.

candidates.title_1: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution
candidates.title_2: TKG-Thinker: Towards Dynamic Reasoning over Temporal Knowledge Graphs via Agentic Reinforcement Learning
candidates.mechanism_1: Strategy distributions evolve through selection (performance-based survival), innovation (mutation), and environmental perturbation (external shocks). Individual agents adapt using local signals while population composition shifts based on relative fitness. Two-layer adaptation - individual learning plus population-level evolution - determines whether strategies persist, collapse, or form coalitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Dual-stage learning: supervised bootstrapping followed by reinforcement-based policy refinement. First stage (supervised fine-tuning) instills core planning capabilities via demonstration data (chain-of-thought). Second stage (reinforcement learning) refines decision policies through dynamic environment interaction using multi-dimensional rewards, enabling autonomous adaptation to complex temporal constraints beyond static supervision coverage.

candidates.title_1: Learning virulence-transmission relationships using causal inference
candidates.title_2: Full-Covariance Chemical Langevin Predator--Prey Diffusion with Absorbing Boundaries
candidates.mechanism_1: Pathogen virulence (harm to host) causally influences transmission rate (spread to new hosts). Increased virulence may increase transmission initially but reduces host mobility decreasing spread. Trade-off creates optimal virulence level maximizing transmission. Evolutionary dynamics drive virulence toward this optimum. Past virulence predicts future transmission but not vice versa (directional causality).
candidates.mechanism_2: Predation creates event-level coupling through biomass conversion: predation-conversion increment (-1,+1) induces strictly negative cross-covariance between prey and predator populations. This mechanistic coupling cannot be captured by diagonal (independent) noise. The coupled dynamics arise from the irreducible stochastic structure of predation events, where prey loss simultaneously causes predator gain, creating intrinsic negative correlation in population fluctuations.

candidates.title_1: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic Limits of Physical Intelligence
candidates.mechanism_1: Threshold-based resource redistribution creates feedback between network structure and resource allocation ability. Agents below threshold solicit help; helpers contribute fractionally based on relatedness. Higher local density and relational closeness emerge as redistribution-dependent survival creates centralized clusters through cooperative resource sharing.
candidates.mechanism_2: Local monomer depletion creates negative feedback between network density and growth. Epiplexity (structural information encoding) and empowerment (control capacity) provide recognition vs. control axes for physical intelligence. Landauer-scale closed-cycle benchmarks require explicit boundary-closure and reset assumptions - without charging for external low-entropy resources, information gain and dissipation decouple.

candidates.title_1: Indirect Reciprocity with Environmental Feedback
candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic cost-controllability tradeoff in metabolic currency coupling

candidates.mechanism_2: Controllability-efficiency tradeoff in coupled resource management: independent regulation of multiple coupled resources requires balanced abundances to prevent cross-interference, but balanced states incur higher thermodynamic costs through increased entropy production.

candidates.title_1: Piecewise Deterministic Markov Processes for Bayesian Inference of PDE Coefficients
candidates.title_2: Evolutionary Mapping of Neural Networks to Spatial Accelerators
candidates.mechanism_1: Surrogate-assisted proposal generation with dynamic correction bounds enables efficient exploration when exact evaluations are expensive: surrogate provides cheap proposals, dynamic offset enforcement maintains correctness.
candidates.mechanism_2: Evolutionary optimization with hardware-in-the-loop feedback automates expert-driven resource mapping by directly evaluating candidate mappings on target hardware, learning effective heuristics without manual tuning.

candidates.title_2: Decaying Sensitivity of the Zero Solution for a Class of Nonlinear Optimal Control Problems
candidates.mechanism_1: Minimal monitoring sets (vertices detecting edge failures through distance changes) have structural uniqueness in certain graph classes. candidates.title_1: Intermittent precipitation and spatial Allee effects drive irregular vegetation patterns in semiarid ecosystems
candidates.title_2: DSB: Dynamic Sliding Block Scheduling for Diffusion LLMs
candidates.mechanism_1: Plants facilitate neighboring growth through local resource modification. Facilitation competes with resource competition. When precipitation is intermittent, facilitation-competition balance creates spatial vegetation patterns. Below threshold density, vegetation collapses due to weakened facilitation (spatial Allee effect).
candidates.mechanism_2: Dynamic resource allocation adapts commitment timing to local uncertainty: allocating more processing to uncertain regions while quickly committing to certain regions avoids premature decisions and improves both quality and efficiency.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: Unveiling Scaling Behaviors in Molecular Language Models: Effects of Model Size, Data, and Representation
candidates.mechanism_1: As a system approaches a bifurcation point, convergence to steady state slows dramatically. Near criticality, relaxation time diverges according to universal scaling laws. The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Scaling behavior depends jointly on model capacity, training data volume, and input representation structure: different representations yield different scaling exponents, making representation choice as critical as model size for performance.

candidates.title_1: Mean-Field Price Formation on Trees with a Network of Relative Performance Concerns
candidates.title_2: Advancing Opinion Dynamics Modeling with Neural Diffusion-Convection-Reaction Equation
candidates.mechanism_1: Agents care about their performance relative to connected peers. Relative performance concerns create strategic interdependencies through network links. Risk-taking behavior adjusts based on peer comparisons. Network topology determines how competitive pressures propagate. This peer comparison mechanism affects equilibrium asset prices through aggregated strategic adjustments.
candidates.mechanism_2: Opinion evolution emerges from three coupled processes: diffusion (local influence spreading), convection (directional opinion flow driven by global trends), and reaction (endogenous opinion change). Each level operates at distinct scales—local peer-to-peer, global population-wide, and individual internal—that interact through multi-scale coupling. The system exhibits dynamics from interacting particle theory projected onto opinion space.

candidates.title_2: Integrating prior knowledge in equation discovery: Interpretable symmetry-informed neural networks and symbolic regression via characteristic curves
candidates.mechanism_1: Iterative denoising of sparse representations conditioned on coarse predictions refines boundaries in low-data regimes: sparse encoding reduces sample complexity, conditioning provides structural constraints, iteration improves precision.

Symmetry constraints and symbolic regression narrow the search space by encoding domain knowledge. The characteristic curves framework enables modular integration of structural priors, with identifiability emerging from imposed constraints. Prior knowledge acts as regularization, discarding undesirable models and selecting among observationally-equivalent alternatives.

candidates.title_2: Entanglement improves coordination in distributed systems

Non-uniqueness phenomena emerge - multiple distinct policies can achieve same target distribution.
candidates.mechanism_2: Non-local quantum correlations enable superior coordination in distributed systems with convex reward functions: instantaneous shared randomness from entanglement avoids communication latency costs when longer uninterrupted processing yields superlinear rewards.

candidates.title_1: Microbiome association diversity reflects proximity to the edge of instability
candidates.title_2: PhysicsAgentABM: Physics-Guided Generative Agent-Based Modeling

Convergence to full safe region is proven, with specified probability that learned region remains safe. Passive-to-active transition balances safety (conservative initial estimates) with exploration (gradual expansion).

candidates.mechanism_1: System state evolves discretely through iterated function. Scaling symmetry preserves dynamics under magnification/contraction. Attentional mechanisms over directed hypergraphs explicitly model higher-order interactions, mitigating representational bottleneck and enabling complex coordination where pairwise methods fail.
candidates.mechanism_2: Higher-order information creates heterogeneous risk perception targeting structural hubs and high-participation nodes, preventing contagion exploitation of these critical paths at lower social cost than uniform interventions.

candidates.title_1: Structure-aware imitation dynamics on higher-order networks
candidates.title_2: GenAI-Net: A Generative AI Framework for Automated Biomolecular Network Design
candidates.mechanism_1: Higher-order network structure (beyond pairwise) shapes imitation dynamics through group-dependent adoption rates. Information diversity achieved through structured sampling from local neighborhoods. Adoption probability depends on group composition and size, not just neighbor count. Network hypergraph structure determines equilibrium strategy distributions through sampling bias.
candidates.mechanism_2: Biomolecular network design reverses the typical simulation workflow: instead of checking proposed networks, an agent proposes reactions guided by behavioral specification. Coupling generative proposal with simulation-based evaluation (user-specified objective) produces topologically diverse solutions. The generative component explores reaction space, while simulation evaluates functional fit, enabling automated discovery of networks implementing desired dynamics from specifications.

candidates.title_1: Growth Models Under Uniform Catastrophes
candidates.title_2: Distinguishable spreading dynamics in microbial communities
candidates.mechanism_1: Catastrophic events trigger population dispersal strategies. Dispersion affects survival probability and extinction time. Spatial constraints modulate the effectiveness of dispersal - unconstrained dispersion improves survival while spatial limits reduce the benefit, creating a trade-off between mobility and stability.
candidates.mechanism_2: Proliferation limitations determine spreading dynamics. Growth arrest causes superlinear spreading at reduced rate. Pressure-limited growth produces linear constant-speed spreading. Nutrient-limited growth exhibits phase transition: superlinear when nutrient supply is high, sublinear when depleted. Nutrient supply and conversion efficiency determine phase boundary. Spreading rate distinguishes dominant limitation type.

candidates.title_1: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks in a shared and finite pool of monomers
candidates.title_2: Game-Theoretic and Algorithmic Analyses of Multi-Agent Routing under Crossing Costs
candidates.mechanism_1: Multiple branched actin networks compete for shared monomer pool. Network growth locally depletes monomers creating negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Local depletion couples network growth rates through shared resource. Under weak competition, networks coexist at steady state. Under strong competition, selection replaces coexistence - fastest-growing network excludes others. Competition strength determined by monomer availability and consumption rates.
candidates.mechanism_2: Crossing cost (product of opposing-direction agent counts) quantifies conflict risk in asynchronous multi-agent routing. Pure Nash equilibria exist when agents minimize individual crossing exposure. Equilibrium emergence dynamics depend on network structure - general case is PLS-complete, but polynomial-time solvable under mild structural conditions.

candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic cost-controllability tradeoff in metabolic currency coupling

candidates.mechanism_2: Controllability-efficiency tradeoff in coupled resource management: independent regulation of multiple coupled resources requires balanced abundances to prevent cross-interference, but balanced states incur higher thermodynamic costs through increased entropy production.

candidates.mechanism_2: Safe operating regions are learned through two-phase online process: passive inference phase (causal inference + Gaussian process regression constructs initial safe region from observations) followed by intervention phase (active Bayesian learning gradually expands region). Convergence to full safe region is proven, with specified probability that learned region remains safe. Passive-to-active transition balances safety (conservative initial estimates) with exploration (gradual expansion).

candidates.mechanism_2: Single driving signal targeting one network node suppresses extreme events network-wide through dominance mechanism. candidates.mechanism_2: Multi-agent performance is governed by certainty preference: reducing entropy at any stage for any agent is critical for correct solutions. Uncertainty dynamics are largely determined in the first interaction round, establishing baseline entropy that constrains subsequent evolution. Lower base model entropy during initial problem-solving directly benefits multi-agent outcomes, suggesting initial uncertainty sets persistent constraints on collaborative effectiveness.

candidates.mechanism_2: Expert importance exhibits dual structure: relational importance (routing frequency, interaction centrality) diverges from intrinsic importance (causal influence via gradient attribution). candidates.mechanism_1: Loss scales inversely with depth due to functionally similar layers reducing error through ensemble averaging rather than compositional learning. Residual architecture bias combined with incompatible target functions produces inefficient yet robust regime. Improving efficiency requires architectural innovations encouraging compositional depth usage instead of redundant layer averaging.
candidates.mechanism_2: Extreme precipitation exhibits multi-scale structure requiring decoupled modeling. Wavelet decomposition separates low-frequency advection (stable, deterministic drift) from high-frequency convection (stochastic, transient singularities). An approximation network models deterministic trends, isolating them from regression-to-mean bias. A detail network captures spatially-localized stochastic fluctuations. Refiner module dynamically reconstructs these decoupled components, preserving extreme values and sharp boundaries lost in standard pixel-wise regression.

Heterogeneity is double-edged: influence asymmetry facilitates cooperation, motivation asymmetry degrades it.
candidates.mechanism_2: Productivity in scientific and technological activities increases with Katz-Bonacich centrality capturing within-activity and cross-activity complementarities. Scientific productivity significantly enhances technological output (asymmetric linkage), but technology does not reciprocally boost science. Science-driven innovation model where collaboration structure influences knowledge creation through network position and cross-domain spillovers.

candidates.mechanism_2: High-budget agents (whales) shift market prices proportionally to their capital share. Distortion duration depends on non-whale learning rates and herding intensity. Fast learners correct distortions quickly; herding amplifies and prolongs whale influence as coordinated followers reinforce biased prices even when informed traders exit.

candidates.title_2: Distributed delay stabilizes bistable genetic networks
candidates.mechanism_1: Markov dynamics combine heterogeneity and asymmetry (broken detailed balance). Heterogeneity parameter controls transition rate variability. Asymmetry parameter controls forward-backward correlation. Critical locus emerges where relaxation times diverge. Entropy production and predictive information depend strongly on heterogeneity but weakly on asymmetry. Near criticality, small heterogeneity changes cause large dynamical shifts.
candidates.mechanism_2: Protein production involves delayed multi-step process (transcription, translation, folding, oligomerization). Delay is distributed (noisy) due to stochastic process durations. Increasing delay noise dramatically stabilizes metastable states in bistable circuits. Mean residence times in metastable states increase with delay distribution width. Distributed delay prevents unwanted switching caused by small fluctuations while allowing controlled transitions.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: From Discrete to Continuous Mixed Populations of Conformists, Nonconformists, and Imitators
candidates.mechanism_1: As a system approaches a bifurcation point, convergence to steady state slows dramatically. Near criticality, relaxation time diverges according to universal scaling laws. The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Three behavioral types interact: conformists benefit from choosing common strategies, nonconformists profit from rare strategies, and imitators copy highest earners. Population proportions fluctuate in finite populations but equilibrate as population size increases. Strategy proportions undergo perpetual oscillations in small populations, but fluctuation amplitudes approach zero in large populations through stochastic averaging.

candidates.title_1: To clean or not to clean: The free-rider problem in sequentially shared resources
candidates.title_2: Who Restores the Peg? A Mean-Field Game Approach to Model Stablecoin Market Dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Shared resource use creates a cooperation dilemma with cleaning costs, contamination risk, and social incentives forming competing pressures. Cleaning cost primarily determines stability of altruistic behavior. The system exhibits multi-stability and hysteresis - small parameter changes can cause abrupt shifts between cooperation and free-riding equilibria.
candidates.mechanism_2: Stablecoin prices de-peg during stress events. Arbitrageurs restore the peg by trading against deviations. Arbitrage profitability depends on deviation magnitude and transaction costs. Insufficient arbitrage activity allows persistent de-pegging. Mean-field dynamics aggregate individual arbitrage decisions into collective peg restoration. Market participant heterogeneity and risk aversion determine collective restoration speed.

candidates.title_1: Controlling extreme events in neuronal networks: A single driving signal approach
candidates.title_2: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models
candidates.mechanism_1: A single driving signal applied to one network component suppresses extreme events throughout the system. In coupled components, drive breaks phase-locking between elements. In networked systems, drive disrupts protoevent frequency dynamics causing frequency decoupling that prevents extreme event cascades.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coupled multi-timescale dynamics with threshold-based control transition. Fast epidemiological process coupled to slow ecological oscillation, where amplitude of slow cycle determines disease persistence via threshold (ecological reproduction number). Natural control sufficient above threshold; below threshold requires engineered intervention to navigate both timescales simultaneously.

candidates.title_1: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models
candidates.title_2: Understanding the temperature response of biological systems: Part II -- Network-level mechanisms and emergent dynamics

Fast epidemiological process coupled to slow ecological oscillation, where amplitude of slow cycle determines disease persistence via threshold (ecological reproduction number). candidates.mechanism_2: Individual Arrhenius-like temperature dependence at reaction level transforms into non-Arrhenius scaling, thermal limits, and temperature compensation at network level. Coupled biochemical reactions with temperature-modulated kinetics exhibit emergent system-level temperature response curves that differ from component behaviors. Network coupling creates effective nonlinearities and collective constraints, transforming simple exponential dependencies into complex organism-level thermal responses.

candidates.title_1: Metastability and ripening of multi-component liquid mixtures
candidates.title_2: Intermittent precipitation and spatial Allee effects drive irregular vegetation patterns in semiarid ecosystems
candidates.mechanism_1: Multi-component mixtures undergo phase separation through unstable coexistence. Droplets grow via Ostwald ripening with characteristic scaling (radius ~ t^1/3, number ~ n^-2/3). Glass-like relaxation emerges from disordered interactions among components, creating long-lived metastable states. Different wetting angles characterize metastable configurations. Relaxation delay arises from kinetic barriers between metastable states.
candidates.mechanism_2: Intermittent resource pulses interact with positive density dependence (Allee effects) to generate irregular spatial clusters. During favorable pulses, local facilitation enables patch expansion; during scarcity, neighborhood density determines survival. Resilience emerges from spatial covariance and local density rather than total biomass.

candidates.title_1: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks in a shared and finite pool of monomers
candidates.title_2: Plasticity, hysteresis, and recovery mechanisms in spider silk fibers
candidates.mechanism_1: Local monomer depletion from network growth creates negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Higher density causes faster monomer consumption and slower growth. Multiple networks sharing finite monomer pool reach steady states through self-regulation. Under strong competition, coexistence transitions to selection.
candidates.mechanism_2: Parallel networks with distinct failure modes enable large reversible deformations: brittle bond network governs initial stiffness and yield point, entropic elastic network enables large deformations post-yield; reorganization and rebonding during recovery locks new equilibrium with increased stiffness.

candidates.title_1: PhysicsAgentABM: Physics-Guided Generative Agent-Based Modeling
candidates.title_2: Minimal-Action Discrete Schrödinger Bridge Matching for Peptide Sequence Design
candidates.mechanism_1: Population-level inference with uncertainty-aware fusion decouples global dynamics from individual variability: clustering behaviorally similar entities, encoding mechanistic priors, and fusing uncertain predictions at cluster level enables scalable simulation.
candidates.mechanism_2: Controlled transport relative to informed reference process yields low-action paths through high-likelihood regions: defining generation as deviation from biologically-informed baseline keeps intermediate states plausible throughout trajectory.

candidates.title_1: Habitat heterogeneity and dispersal network structure as drivers of metacommunity dynamics
candidates.title_2: PhysicsAgentABM: Physics-Guided Generative Agent-Based Modeling
candidates.mechanism_1: Effective dispersal kernel encodes both microscopic dynamical parameters and network topology in coarse-grained metacommunity model. Metapopulation capacity generalizes to non-uniform local extinction rates. Stochasticity from finite carrying capacities yields reduced one-dimensional description with universal finite-size scaling laws for extinction times. Homogeneous environments require fine-tuned marginally stable coexistence to avoid monodominance.
candidates.mechanism_2: Population-level inference with uncertainty-aware fusion decouples global dynamics from individual variability: clustering behaviorally similar entities, encoding mechanistic priors, and fusing uncertain predictions at cluster level enables scalable simulation.

candidates.title_1: Mean-Field Price Formation on Trees with a Network of Relative Performance Concerns
candidates.title_2: Mathematical Modeling of Common-Pool Resources: A Comprehensive Review of Bioeconomics, Strategic Interaction, and Complex Adaptive Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Agents care about their performance relative to connected peers. Relative performance concerns create strategic interdependencies through network links. Risk-taking behavior adjusts based on peer comparisons. Network topology determines how competitive pressures propagate. This peer comparison mechanism affects equilibrium asset prices through aggregated strategic adjustments.
candidates.mechanism_2: Paradigm shift from static optimization to dynamic resilience in commons management. Early deterministic bioeconomic models established individual-collective efficiency tension. Ostrom turn integrated institutional monitoring and sanctions into game theory. Evolutionary dynamics and behavioral economics relaxed rationality. Stochastic models capture spatial heterogeneity and noise-induced regime shifts with early warning signals.

candidates.title_1: Strategic Interactions in Science and Technology Networks: Substitutes or Complements?
candidates.title_2: Estimating measures of information processing during cognitive tasks using functional magnetic resonance imaging
candidates.mechanism_1: An agent's position in a collaboration network determines their productivity. Higher network centrality increases output through strategic complementarities with connected agents. Activity in one domain (scientific) enhances productivity in another domain (technological), but this effect is asymmetric - the reverse direction shows no detectable influence.
candidates.mechanism_2: Active information storage (within-region retention), transfer entropy (directed flow), and net synergy (redundancy vs. synergy) quantify information processing. Cross mutual information combines resting-state and task data to address limited samples. AIS increases with cognitive load in fronto-parietal regions; TE reveals enhanced directed flows; net synergy shows global redundancy shift.

candidates.title_1: Manipulation in Prediction Markets: An Agent-based Modeling Experiment
candidates.title_2: Mathematical Modeling of Common-Pool Resources: A Comprehensive Review of Bioeconomics, Strategic Interaction, and Complex Adaptive Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: High-budget agents (whales) shift market prices proportionally to their capital share. Distortion duration depends on non-whale learning rates and herding intensity. Fast learners correct distortions quickly; herding amplifies and prolongs whale influence as coordinated followers reinforce biased prices even when informed traders exit.
candidates.mechanism_2: Paradigm shift from static optimization to dynamic resilience in commons management. candidates.title_1: Inverse Depth Scaling From Most Layers Being Similar
candidates.title_2: Muon in Associative Memory Learning: Training Dynamics and Scaling Laws
candidates.mechanism_1: Loss scales inversely with depth due to functionally similar layers reducing error through ensemble averaging rather than compositional learning. Residual architecture bias combined with incompatible target functions produces inefficient yet robust regime. Improving efficiency requires architectural innovations encouraging compositional depth usage instead of redundant layer averaging.
candidates.mechanism_2: Sign-based gradient transformation equalizes learning rates across hierarchical frequency components by removing magnitude dependence, eliminating bottlenecks from low-frequency modes and enabling exponentially faster convergence.

candidates.title_1: All-Atom GPCR-Ligand Simulation via Residual Isometric Latent Flow
candidates.title_2: Fully Automated Adaptive Parameter Selection for 3-D High-order Nyström Boundary Integral Equation Methods
candidates.mechanism_1: Residual dynamics modeling via decoupling static topology from temporal fluctuations. System learns isometric latent representation preserving geometric constraints (static topology), then models temporal evolution via relative displacements anchored to initial structure rather than absolute coordinates. Separates invariant structural relationships from dynamic conformational changes, improving computational efficiency while maintaining physical fidelity.
candidates.mechanism_2: Unified adaptive schemes eliminate manual parameter tuning while maintaining accuracy across diverse problem instances: automatic error-driven refinement of resolution and interaction distances adapts to local geometric complexity.

candidates.title_1: Compressing Complexity: A Critical Synthesis of Structural, Analytical, and Data-Driven Dimensionality Reduction in Dynamical Networks
candidates.title_2: Decaying Sensitivity of the Zero Solution for a Class of Nonlinear Optimal Control Problems
candidates.mechanism_1: Three reduction paradigms form Pareto frontier between computational tractability and physical fidelity: structural coarse-graining (spectral/topological contraction), analytical reduction (moment closures preserving mechanisms), and data-driven reduction (manifold learning prioritizing prediction). Selection governed by no-free-lunch theorem - epistemological trade-off between causal mechanism preservation versus predictive power.
candidates.mechanism_2: Localized perturbations in graph-structured systems induce optimal trajectories that decay exponentially with graph distance from perturbation source. Spatial decay arises from interaction topology: influences propagate through network edges but attenuate geometrically with path length. Graph distance acts as effective spatial dimension governing perturbation propagation, with topology imposing decay rate independently of detailed dynamics.

candidates.title_1: Compressing Complexity: A Critical Synthesis of Structural, Analytical, and Data-Driven Dimensionality Reduction in Dynamical Networks
candidates.title_2: GenAI-Net: A Generative AI Framework for Automated Biomolecular Network Design

Coupling generative proposal with simulation-based evaluation (user-specified objective) produces topologically diverse solutions. candidates.title_1: Habitat heterogeneity and dispersal network structure as drivers of metacommunity dynamics
candidates.title_2: Intelligent Control of Transportation Flow in Physarum Networks

Network topology encodes dispersal effectiveness through an effective kernel.
candidates.mechanism_2: Physarum network morphology responds to environmental stimuli by expanding or retracting tubes. Cytoplasmic flow bidirectionally transports nutrients through the network. Flow patterns optimize based on nutrient source locations. Network adapts topology through tube reinforcement when flow is high and tube degradation when flow is low. This creates an intelligent search for optimal transport paths through flow-structure feedback.

candidates.title_1: Decoupling Variance and Scale-Invariant Updates in Adaptive Gradient Descent for Unified Vector and Matrix Optimization
candidates.title_2: GP-DHT: A Dual-Head Transformer with Contras-tive Learning for Predicting Gene Regulatory Rela-tionships across Species from Single-Cell Data
candidates.mechanism_1: Decomposing AdaGrad into variance adaptation and scale-invariant terms creates unified framework bridging vector-based and matrix spectral optimization. Variance adaptation improves blockwise smoothness for faster convergence. Decoupling enables seamless transition from coordinate-wise adaptation (Adam) to spectral descent (Muon) by separating second-order correction from coordinate scaling.
candidates.mechanism_2: Dual-scope representation learning with contrastive regularization under distribution shift. System captures both local pairwise regulatory logic and global cross-context expression patterns via dual-head architecture. Contrastive learning enforces structural constraints in representation space, providing robustness against noise, sparsity, and cross-domain distributional shifts beyond what supervised signal alone provides.

candidates.title_2: Spatiotemporal Topological Phase Transition in non-Hermitian Photonic System

System parameters (stiffness degree, mass symmetry, friction) determine stability boundaries and response amplitude.
candidates.mechanism_2: Non-Hermitian parameter tuning drives continuous transition between energy-localized and momentum-localized topological phases: varying loss and coupling enables PT-symmetry breaking that smoothly transforms gap structure from spatial to temporal character.

candidates.title_1: Social Catalysts, Not Moral Agents: The Illusion of Alignment in LLM Societies
candidates.title_2: Disentangling Causal Importance from Emergent Structure in Multi-Expert Orchestration
candidates.mechanism_1: External behavioral anchors induce strategic compliance and cognitive offloading without genuine norm internalization: agents mimic anchor behavior locally to reduce cognitive load, but revert to self-interested behavior when anchors absent or unobservable.
candidates.mechanism_2: Expert importance exhibits dual structure: relational importance (routing frequency, interaction centrality) diverges from intrinsic importance (causal influence via gradient attribution). Frequently-routed experts may act as structural hubs with limited functional impact, while sparsely-routed experts can be causally critical. Masking intrinsically-important experts causes disproportionate collapse in interaction topology compared to masking frequent peers, revealing hidden causal dependencies.

candidates.title_1: Optimal Learning-Rate Schedules under Functional Scaling Laws: Power Decay and Warmup-Stable-Decay

Easy-task regime benefits from gradual decay, hard-task regime requires maintaining peak resources until near completion.
candidates.mechanism_2: Functional organization transitions at critical connectivity: below threshold, cascades die locally creating a functional desert (sparse, transient responses); near percolation threshold, system-spanning cascades emerge enabling discriminative responses. Connectivity-driven transition introduces coherence timescales and weak path-dependence into otherwise memoryless exploration. Network dynamics alone soften combinatorial feasibility barriers without requiring specific biochemistry.

candidates.title_2: Modeling tumor progression in heterogeneous microenvironments: A cellular automata approach

candidates.title_1: Uncertainty in Island-based Ecosystem Services and Climate Change
candidates.title_2: The impact of heterogeneity on the co-evolution of cooperation and epidemic spreading in complex networks
candidates.mechanism_1: Transmission rate increases with infected density. Recovery rate decreases infection duration. When transmission exceeds recovery (R0>1), epidemic spreads exponentially. Vaccination reduces susceptible population shifting R0 below 1. Spatial heterogeneity creates local pockets where R0 varies.
candidates.mechanism_2: Cooperation and disease transmission coevolve through network structure. Structural heterogeneity creates leverage points - highly connected hubs adopt protection due to amplified risk, catalyzing cooperation. Cost heterogeneity creates weakest links - low-risk individuals free-ride and act as disease reservoirs, undermining cooperation. Heterogeneity is double-edged: influence asymmetry facilitates cooperation, motivation asymmetry degrades it.

candidates.title_1: Cross-feeding yields high-dimensional chaos and coexistence of species beyond exclusion principle
candidates.title_2: Advancing Opinion Dynamics Modeling with Neural Diffusion-Convection-Reaction Equation
candidates.mechanism_1: Species cross-feed through metabolite leakage and uptake. Competitive uptake of leaked chemicals creates coupled population-chemical dynamics. Network structure determines attractor types: fixed points, limit cycles, low-dimensional chaos, or high-dimensional chaos. High-dimensional chaos enables coexistence beyond competitive exclusion limits through intermittent switching among quasi-stationary states. Chemical dynamics explore high-dimensional space while populations switch intermittently.
candidates.mechanism_2: Opinion evolution emerges from three coupled processes: diffusion (local influence spreading), convection (directional opinion flow driven by global trends), and reaction (endogenous opinion change). Each level operates at distinct scales—local peer-to-peer, global population-wide, and individual internal—that interact through multi-scale coupling. The system exhibits dynamics from interacting particle theory projected onto opinion space.

candidates.title_1: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
candidates.title_2: From semantic memory to collective creativity: A generative cognitive foundation for social creativity models
candidates.mechanism_1: Threshold-based resource redistribution creates feedback between network structure and resource allocation ability. Agents below threshold solicit help; helpers contribute fractionally based on relatedness. Higher local density and relational closeness emerge as redistribution-dependent survival creates centralized clusters through cooperative resource sharing.
candidates.mechanism_2: Semantic network topology determines ideational breadth - low modularity yields broader exploration. When agents exchange ideation traces, lower pre-interaction overlap predicts larger stimulation gains. Shared inspiration sources create network-level redundancy as convergent semantic neighborhoods limit diversity of generated ideas.

candidates.title_1: Cell size control in bacteria is modulated through extrinsic noise, single-cell- and population-growth
candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic Limits of Physical Intelligence
candidates.mechanism_1: Cell size fluctuates due to noisy growth rates and size-dependent division noise. Size homeostasis mechanisms compensate for fluctuations through size control strategies. Population dynamics alter size distributions compared to single lineages - exponential population growth changes the effective size control measured in constant-volume experiments. Extrinsic growth noise and population structure jointly determine observed size distributions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Local monomer depletion creates negative feedback between network density and growth. Epiplexity (structural information encoding) and empowerment (control capacity) provide recognition vs. control axes for physical intelligence. Landauer-scale closed-cycle benchmarks require explicit boundary-closure and reset assumptions - without charging for external low-entropy resources, information gain and dissipation decouple.

candidates.title_1: Indirect Reciprocity with Environmental Feedback
candidates.title_2: Effect of higher-order interactions on noisy majority-rule dynamics with random group sizes
candidates.mechanism_1: Individual behaviors shape reputation through social norms while simultaneously affecting collective resource levels. Environmental changes alter payoff structures, creating feedback between strategic behavior and resource dynamics. Reputation-based cooperation interacts with ecological constraints - cooperative behaviors deplete or enhance shared resources, which then reshape the incentives for future cooperation.
candidates.mechanism_2: Variable group sizes in majority-rule dynamics create heterogeneous influence through effective majority leverage. Rare large-group events can realign substantial population fractions. Critical threshold for independence depends on group-size distribution - heavy-tailed distributions enhance robustness to disorder through occasional macroscopic coordination events.

candidates.title_1: Game-Theoretic and Algorithmic Analyses of Multi-Agent Routing under Crossing Costs
candidates.title_2: Higher-order adaptive behaviors outperform pairwise strategies in mitigating contagion dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Crossing cost (product of opposing-direction agent counts) quantifies conflict risk in asynchronous multi-agent routing. Pure Nash equilibria exist when agents minimize individual crossing exposure. Equilibrium emergence dynamics depend on network structure - general case is PLS-complete, but polynomial-time solvable under mild structural conditions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Higher-order information creates heterogeneous risk perception targeting structural hubs and high-participation nodes, preventing contagion exploitation of these critical paths at lower social cost than uniform interventions.

candidates.title_1: Collaboration for the Bioeconomy -- Evidence from Innovation Output in Sweden, 1970-2021
candidates.title_2: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks in a shared and finite pool of monomers
candidates.mechanism_1: Firms collaborate forming innovation network. Central firms access diverse knowledge from multiple partners enhancing innovation output. Peripheral firms limited by fewer connections. Network structure (centrality) determines innovation capacity. Successful innovators attract more partners (preferential attachment) reinforcing centrality advantage.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multiple branched actin networks compete for shared monomer pool. Network growth locally depletes monomers creating negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Local depletion couples network growth rates through shared resource. Under weak competition, networks coexist at steady state. Under strong competition, selection replaces coexistence - fastest-growing network excludes others. Competition strength determined by monomer availability and consumption rates.

candidates.title_1: Normative Equivalence in Human-AI Cooperation: Behaviour, Not Identity, Drives Cooperation in Mixed-Agent Groups
candidates.title_2: On the occupation measure of evolution models with vanishing mutations

These normative mechanisms operate identically regardless of agent type, creating stable cooperation patterns through behavioral feedback.
candidates.mechanism_2: Collective oscillations in many-body systems mediate nonlinear wave mixing without requiring strong single-particle nonlinearity. Coherent many-body response creates effective nonlinearity through collective mode coupling. Weak individual interactions amplified by collective dynamics generate strong wave mixing. Effective interaction strength scales with system size or coupling density.

candidates.title_1: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
candidates.title_2: Full-Covariance Chemical Langevin Predator--Prey Diffusion with Absorbing Boundaries
candidates.mechanism_1: When agents fall below a resource threshold, they solicit resources from connected neighbors based on relatedness. Redistribution creates feedback between kinship network structure and reproduction ability. This enables population survival at lower resource densities but increases network heterogeneity and local centralization.
candidates.mechanism_2: Predation creates event-level coupling through biomass conversion: predation-conversion increment (-1,+1) induces strictly negative cross-covariance between prey and predator populations. This mechanistic coupling cannot be captured by diagonal (independent) noise. The coupled dynamics arise from the irreducible stochastic structure of predation events, where prey loss simultaneously causes predator gain, creating intrinsic negative correlation in population fluctuations.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: Plasticity, hysteresis, and recovery mechanisms in spider silk fibers

The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Parallel networks with distinct failure modes enable large reversible deformations: brittle bond network governs initial stiffness and yield point, entropic elastic network enables large deformations post-yield; reorganization and rebonding during recovery locks new equilibrium with increased stiffness.

candidates.title_1: Microbiome association diversity reflects proximity to the edge of instability
candidates.title_2: Numerical stationary states for nonlocal Fokker-Planck equations via fixed points of consistency maps
candidates.mechanism_1: Microbial communities operate near edge of instability - transition from stable fixed-point to chaos controlled by network sparsity and interaction heterogeneity. Healthy gut microbiomes cluster near instability edge with broader associations; dysbiosis shifts toward stable regimes with narrower association distributions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Stationary states (both stable and unstable) are computed via fixed-point iteration of a consistency map derived from the PDE and nonlocal interactions. The method is agnostic to dynamical stability—detecting equilibria regardless of whether they attract or repel trajectories. This separates statics (equilibrium existence) from dynamics (stability), enabling discovery of unstable stationary configurations invisible to time-evolution methods.

Introducing a latent temperature (counterfactual unconstrained trajectory) resolves information loss. Energy conservation enforces duality: total latent heat dissipated equals accumulated exceedance of latent temperature above melting point. This duality is mathematically equivalent to Wasserstein-1 distance (optimal transport) between latent and observed trajectories, with phase change emerging as transport that projects continuous energy variability onto constrained thermodynamic boundaries.

candidates.title_2: PhageMind: Generalized Strain-level Phage Host Range Prediction via Meta-learning

candidates.mechanism_2: Augmented state space with corrective dynamics extends equilibrium-based learning to non-conservative systems: adding auxiliary variables and non-reciprocal correction terms to learning dynamics recovers exact gradients despite broken energy conservation.

candidates.title_2: Neural Ordinary Differential Equations for Simulating Metabolic Pathway Dynamics from Time-Series Multiomics Data
candidates.mechanism_1: Three reduction paradigms form Pareto frontier between computational tractability and physical fidelity: structural coarse-graining (spectral/topological contraction), analytical reduction (moment closures preserving mechanisms), and data-driven reduction (manifold learning prioritizing prediction). Selection governed by no-free-lunch theorem - epistemological trade-off between causal mechanism preservation versus predictive power.
candidates.mechanism_2: Proteome-metabolome dynamics are modeled as continuous interplay via Neural ODEs. Rather than requiring pre-specified mechanistic knowledge, NODEs infer latent interaction structure directly from time-series multiomics data. Learned continuous dynamics enable simulation of temporal trajectories and anticipation of intervention effects, capturing complex feedback between protein expression and metabolite concentrations without manually encoding pathway topology.

candidates.title_1: Growth Models Under Uniform Catastrophes
candidates.title_2: Cross-feeding yields high-dimensional chaos and coexistence of species beyond exclusion principle
candidates.mechanism_1: Catastrophic events trigger population dispersal strategies. Dispersion affects survival probability and extinction time. Spatial constraints modulate the effectiveness of dispersal - unconstrained dispersion improves survival while spatial limits reduce the benefit, creating a trade-off between mobility and stability.
candidates.mechanism_2: Species cross-feed through metabolite leakage and uptake. Competitive uptake of leaked chemicals creates coupled population-chemical dynamics. Network structure determines attractor types: fixed points, limit cycles, low-dimensional chaos, or high-dimensional chaos. High-dimensional chaos enables coexistence beyond competitive exclusion limits through intermittent switching among quasi-stationary states. Chemical dynamics explore high-dimensional space while populations switch intermittently.

candidates.title_1: The impact of heterogeneity on the co-evolution of cooperation and epidemic spreading in complex networks
candidates.title_2: The Architecture of Illusion: Network Opacity and Strategic Escalation
candidates.mechanism_1: Cooperation and disease transmission coevolve through network structure. Structural heterogeneity creates leverage points - highly connected hubs adopt protection due to amplified risk, catalyzing cooperation. Cost heterogeneity creates weakest links - low-risk individuals free-ride and act as disease reservoirs, undermining cooperation. Heterogeneity is double-edged: influence asymmetry facilitates cooperation, motivation asymmetry degrades it.
candidates.mechanism_2: Network-mediated observation bias creates systematic misperception in strategic reasoning. Agents observe only network-local sample biased by position (algorithmic ranking, homophily), not global population. Locality parameter controls observation bias magnitude, creating distorted beliefs about opponent sophistication that drive strategic escalation beyond what accurate global information would produce.

candidates.title_1: Contour Refinement using Discrete Diffusion in Low Data Regime
candidates.title_2: ProbFM: Probabilistic Time Series Foundation Model with Uncertainty Decomposition
candidates.mechanism_1: Iterative denoising of sparse representations conditioned on coarse predictions refines boundaries in low-data regimes: sparse encoding reduces sample complexity, conditioning provides structural constraints, iteration improves precision.
candidates.mechanism_2: Deep Evidential Regression decomposes uncertainty into epistemic (model uncertainty) and aleatoric (data noise) components through higher-order evidence learning. Rather than pre-specifying distributions or requiring sampling, the model learns optimal uncertainty representations by treating prediction as distribution over distributions. Single-pass inference yields explicit epistemic-aleatoric separation, enabling principled uncertainty quantification without additional computational cost.

candidates.title_1: Chaotic Dynamics in Extremal Black Holes: A Challenge to the Chaos Bound
candidates.title_2: Noisy nonlocal aggregation model with gradient flow structures
candidates.mechanism_1: Particle motion in extremal configurations exhibits positive Lyapunov exponents indicating sensitivity to initial conditions. Chaos persists even at zero temperature. System parameters (spin, charge) modulate chaos strength - increasing one parameter strengthens chaotic behavior while the other weakens it.
candidates.mechanism_2: Stochastic perturbations in nonlocal aggregation systems create gradient-flow structure in Wasserstein space. Noise regulates density and prevents singular concentration through equilibrium states from constrained energy minimization. Stable energy minimizers emerge from interplay between potential-driven interactions and environmental variability.

System parameters (spin, charge) modulate chaos strength - increasing one parameter strengthens chaotic behavior while the other weakens it.
candidates.mechanism_2: Predation creates event-level coupling through biomass conversion: predation-conversion increment (-1,+1) induces strictly negative cross-covariance between prey and predator populations. This mechanistic coupling cannot be captured by diagonal (independent) noise. The coupled dynamics arise from the irreducible stochastic structure of predation events, where prey loss simultaneously causes predator gain, creating intrinsic negative correlation in population fluctuations.

candidates.title_1: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks in a shared and finite pool of monomers
candidates.title_2: Game-Theoretic and Algorithmic Analyses of Multi-Agent Routing under Crossing Costs
candidates.mechanism_1: Local monomer depletion from network growth creates negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Higher density causes faster monomer consumption and slower growth. Multiple networks sharing finite monomer pool reach steady states through self-regulation. Under strong competition, coexistence transitions to selection.
candidates.mechanism_2: Crossing cost (product of opposing-direction agent counts) quantifies conflict risk in asynchronous multi-agent routing. Pure Nash equilibria exist when agents minimize individual crossing exposure. Equilibrium emergence dynamics depend on network structure - general case is PLS-complete, but polynomial-time solvable under mild structural conditions.

candidates.title_1: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
candidates.title_2: Social Catalysts, Not Moral Agents: The Illusion of Alignment in LLM Societies
candidates.mechanism_1: When agents fall below a resource threshold, they solicit resources from connected neighbors based on relatedness. Redistribution creates feedback between kinship network structure and reproduction ability. This enables population survival at lower resource densities but increases network heterogeneity and local centralization.
candidates.mechanism_2: External behavioral anchors induce strategic compliance and cognitive offloading without genuine norm internalization: agents mimic anchor behavior locally to reduce cognitive load, but revert to self-interested behavior when anchors absent or unobservable.

candidates.title_1: Optimization is Not Enough: Why Problem Formulation Deserves Equal Attention
candidates.title_2: Fully Automated Adaptive Parameter Selection for 3-D High-order Nyström Boundary Integral Equation Methods
candidates.mechanism_1: Sequential optimization respecting variable structure outperforms concurrent optimization ignoring structure: grouping structurally similar variables and optimizing in stages leverages domain knowledge to guide search more effectively.
candidates.mechanism_2: Unified adaptive schemes eliminate manual parameter tuning while maintaining accuracy across diverse problem instances: automatic error-driven refinement of resolution and interaction distances adapts to local geometric complexity.

candidates.title_1: Learning virulence-transmission relationships using causal inference
candidates.title_2: Distinguishable spreading dynamics in microbial communities
candidates.mechanism_1: Pathogen virulence (harm to host) causally influences transmission rate (spread to new hosts). Evolutionary dynamics drive virulence toward this optimum. Past virulence predicts future transmission but not vice versa (directional causality).
candidates.mechanism_2: Proliferation limitations determine spreading dynamics. Growth arrest causes superlinear spreading at reduced rate. Pressure-limited growth produces linear constant-speed spreading. Nutrient-limited growth exhibits phase transition: superlinear when nutrient supply is high, sublinear when depleted. Nutrient supply and conversion efficiency determine phase boundary. Spreading rate distinguishes dominant limitation type.

candidates.title_1: OdysseyArena: Benchmarking Large Language Models For Long-Horizon, Active and Inductive Interactions
candidates.title_2: Numerical stationary states for nonlocal Fokker-Planck equations via fixed points of consistency maps
candidates.mechanism_1: Inductive rule discovery from interaction experience vs deductive execution from explicit rules. Requires building internal model of state evolution from observed trajectories, enabling strategic foresight and coherent planning over extended interaction sequences.

Static individual-level diversity (no adaptation) cultivates search effectiveness especially with large populations. Communication-free construction enables intrinsic concurrency and efficient parallel execution.

candidates.title_1: A Minimal Task Reveals Emergent Path Integration and Object-Location Binding in a Predictive Sequence Model
candidates.title_2: FSCA-Net: Feature-Separated Cross-Attention Network for Robust Multi-Dataset Training

Structured representations with flexible binding emerge to support prediction - new bindings learnable late in sequence, out-of-distribution bindings acquirable through sequential exposure.
candidates.mechanism_2: Feature disentanglement into domain-invariant and domain-specific components mitigates negative transfer in multi-dataset training. Cross-attention fusion adaptively models component interactions. Mutual information optimization maximizes domain-invariant consistency while minimizing domain-specific redundancy. Complementary shared-private representations enable knowledge transfer while preserving dataset-specific discriminability.

candidates.title_1: ProbFM: Probabilistic Time Series Foundation Model with Uncertainty Decomposition
candidates.title_2: Integrating prior knowledge in equation discovery: Interpretable symmetry-informed neural networks and symbolic regression via characteristic curves

candidates.mechanism_2: Equation discovery's ill-posed inverse problem (multiple models yield similar errors) is constrained by incorporating inductive biases. Symmetry constraints and symbolic regression narrow the search space by encoding domain knowledge. The characteristic curves framework enables modular integration of structural priors, with identifiability emerging from imposed constraints. Prior knowledge acts as regularization, discarding undesirable models and selecting among observationally-equivalent alternatives.

candidates.title_1: Taming multiparty entanglement at measurement-induced phase transitions
candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic Origin of Degree-Day Scaling in Phase-Change Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Quantum systems undergo measurement-induced phase transitions when unitary evolution competes with measurements. Below critical measurement rate, volume-law entanglement dominates. Above critical rate, area-law entanglement emerges. Measurement rate acts as control parameter for phase transition. Competing dynamics create distinct entanglement phases. Multiparty entanglement structure differs across phases.
candidates.mechanism_2: Phase transitions impose topological constraints that mask energetic fluctuations. Introducing a latent temperature (counterfactual unconstrained trajectory) resolves information loss. Energy conservation enforces duality: total latent heat dissipated equals accumulated exceedance of latent temperature above melting point. This duality is mathematically equivalent to Wasserstein-1 distance (optimal transport) between latent and observed trajectories, with phase change emerging as transport that projects continuous energy variability onto constrained thermodynamic boundaries.

candidates.title_1: Restoring Sparsity in Potts Machines via Mean-Field Constraints
candidates.title_2: GenAI-Net: A Generative AI Framework for Automated Biomolecular Network Design
candidates.mechanism_1: Mean-field approximation to reduce coupling density. System replaces dense pairwise constraint interactions with dynamically updated single-node bias terms (mean fields), trading exact global coordination for approximate local summaries that maintain solution quality while dramatically reducing graph density and enabling hardware scalability.
candidates.mechanism_2: Biomolecular network design reverses the typical simulation workflow: instead of checking proposed networks, an agent proposes reactions guided by behavioral specification. Coupling generative proposal with simulation-based evaluation (user-specified objective) produces topologically diverse solutions. The generative component explores reaction space, while simulation evaluates functional fit, enabling automated discovery of networks implementing desired dynamics from specifications.

candidates.title_2: Full-Covariance Chemical Langevin Predator--Prey Diffusion with Absorbing Boundaries
