candidates.title_2: Learning to Share: Selective Memory for Efficient Parallel Agentic Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Phase transition in optimal strategy based on task difficulty regime. System exhibits qualitatively different behaviors (power decay vs warmup-stable-decay) separated by sharp threshold determined by ratio of signal learning rate to noise forgetting capacity. Easy-task regime benefits from gradual decay, hard-task regime requires maintaining peak resources until near completion.
candidates.mechanism_2: Learned selective information sharing across parallel exploration processes. Multiple independent teams explore different solution trajectories with learned controller deciding which intermediate results to place in globally-accessible shared memory. Balances exploration diversity (parallel independence) against computational efficiency (reuse of overlapping sub-solutions), using stepwise credit assignment to identify globally useful information.

candidates.title_1: On the occupation measure of evolution models with vanishing mutations
candidates.title_2: Understanding the temperature response of biological systems: Part II -- Network-level mechanisms and emergent dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Collective oscillations in many-body systems mediate nonlinear wave mixing without requiring strong single-particle nonlinearity. Coherent many-body response creates effective nonlinearity through collective mode coupling. Weak individual interactions amplified by collective dynamics generate strong wave mixing. Effective interaction strength scales with system size or coupling density.
candidates.mechanism_2: Individual Arrhenius-like temperature dependence at reaction level transforms into non-Arrhenius scaling, thermal limits, and temperature compensation at network level. Coupled biochemical reactions with temperature-modulated kinetics exhibit emergent system-level temperature response curves that differ from component behaviors. Network coupling creates effective nonlinearities and collective constraints, transforming simple exponential dependencies into complex organism-level thermal responses.

candidates.title_1: Analytical and numerical study of a parametrically excited 2DOF oscillator with nonlinear restoring magnetic force and rotating rectangular rod
candidates.title_2: Impulsive Release Strategies for Wolbachia-Infected Mosquitoes under Temperature-Induced Infection Loss
candidates.mechanism_1: Time-periodic stiffness variation induces parametric excitation in coupled components. System parameters (stiffness degree, mass symmetry, friction) determine stability boundaries and response amplitude.
candidates.mechanism_2: Impulsive periodic intervention under environmental stress. System alternates between autonomous dynamics and discrete intervention events (periodic releases), with environmental perturbations (temperature stress) potentially reversing intervention effects. Success threshold depends on balancing intervention frequency, stress magnitude, and fitness costs to maintain desired state despite continuous environmental pressure.

candidates.title_1: Manipulation in Prediction Markets: An Agent-based Modeling Experiment
candidates.title_2: On the Uncertainty of Large Language Model-Based Multi-Agent Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Manipulators with high budgets attempt to distort prediction market prices. Informed traders with correct beliefs observe price distortions and increase their opposing bets. Market depth and information heterogeneity determine manipulation effectiveness. When information is dispersed, manipulation can temporarily move prices, but informed arbitrage eventually corrects mispricing. Manipulator budget and trader information quality create a competitive dynamic.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multi-agent performance is governed by certainty preference: reducing entropy at any stage for any agent is critical for correct solutions. Uncertainty dynamics are largely determined in the first interaction round, establishing baseline entropy that constrains subsequent evolution. Lower base model entropy during initial problem-solving directly benefits multi-agent outcomes, suggesting initial uncertainty sets persistent constraints on collaborative effectiveness.

candidates.title_2: Full-Covariance Chemical Langevin Predator--Prey Diffusion with Absorbing Boundaries

Global level: relative entropy change identifies high-value samples for prioritized exploration. Local level: absolute entropy peaks identify critical moments within each trajectory. Concentrates computation where information gain is highest rather than uniform distribution.
candidates.mechanism_2: Systems with delayed feedback combined with censored observations face fundamental learning limitations compared to systems with immediate uncensored feedback, creating a sharp performance separation even with identical optimization algorithms.

candidates.title_1: Discrete dynamical systems with scaling and inversion symmetries
candidates.title_2: Crossing the Functional Desert: Cascade-Driven Assembly and Feasibility Transitions in Early Life

Chaotic regime characterized by scaling laws and self-similarity across scales.
candidates.mechanism_2: Functional organization transitions at critical connectivity: below threshold, cascades die locally creating a functional desert (sparse, transient responses); near percolation threshold, system-spanning cascades emerge enabling discriminative responses. candidates.title_2: Microbiome association diversity reflects proximity to the edge of instability

candidates.mechanism_2: Microbial communities operate near edge of instability - transition from stable fixed-point to chaos controlled by network sparsity and interaction heterogeneity. Healthy gut microbiomes cluster near instability edge with broader associations; dysbiosis shifts toward stable regimes with narrower association distributions.

candidates.title_2: Pairwise is Not Enough: Hypergraph Neural Networks for Multi-Agent Pathfinding

This peer comparison mechanism affects equilibrium asset prices through aggregated strategic adjustments.

Masking intrinsically-important experts causes disproportionate collapse in interaction topology compared to masking frequent peers, revealing hidden causal dependencies.

Stable self-efficacy correlates with higher actual and perceived authorship, suggesting self-efficacy acts as a mediating variable between interaction strategy and authorship outcomes.

This duality is mathematically equivalent to Wasserstein-1 distance (optimal transport) between latent and observed trajectories, with phase change emerging as transport that projects continuous energy variability onto constrained thermodynamic boundaries.

This separates statics (equilibrium existence) from dynamics (stability), enabling discovery of unstable stationary configurations invisible to time-evolution methods.
candidates.mechanism_2: Proteome-metabolome dynamics are modeled as continuous interplay via Neural ODEs. Rather than requiring pre-specified mechanistic knowledge, NODEs infer latent interaction structure directly from time-series multiomics data. candidates.mechanism_2: Population-level inference with uncertainty-aware fusion decouples global dynamics from individual variability: clustering behaviorally similar entities, encoding mechanistic priors, and fusing uncertain predictions at cluster level enables scalable simulation.

candidates.title_1: Impact of seed node position on network robustness under localized attacks
candidates.title_2: Higher-order adaptive behaviors outperform pairwise strategies in mitigating contagion dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Localized damage initiates at a seed node and propagates to neighbors. The structural position of the seed node (local connectivity and topology) amplifies or dampens damage progression. Cumulative link severing during attack progression depends critically on seed node characteristics rather than average network properties.
candidates.mechanism_2: Higher-order information creates heterogeneous risk perception targeting structural hubs and high-participation nodes, preventing contagion exploitation of these critical paths at lower social cost than uniform interventions.

candidates.title_1: Discrete dynamical systems with scaling and inversion symmetries
candidates.title_2: The quenched structured coalescent for diploid population models on finite graphs with large migrations and uneven offspring distributions
candidates.mechanism_1: System state evolves discretely through iterated function. Scaling symmetry preserves dynamics under magnification/contraction. Near fixed points, small perturbations grow exponentially (positive Lyapunov exponent) causing sensitive dependence. Trajectories confined to fractal attractor with non-integer dimension. Chaotic regime characterized by scaling laws and self-similarity across scales.
candidates.mechanism_2: Conditioning on rare large events (quenched dynamics) versus averaging over event realizations (annealed dynamics) yields qualitatively different limiting processes: quenched limits preserve event-specific structure, annealed limits smooth over variability.

candidates.title_1: The near-continuum mechanism for extended Boltzmann theory: the non-equilibrium relaxation
candidates.title_2: Numerical stationary states for nonlocal Fokker-Planck equations via fixed points of consistency maps
candidates.mechanism_1: Multi-mode coupled non-equilibrium relaxation with cross-mode energy exchange. System tracks multiple energy pools (translational, rotational degrees of freedom) with distinct temperatures evolving through collision-mediated energy transfer. Relaxation dynamics exhibit mode coupling where heat flux interactions between pools affect global equilibration rates, creating thermal conductivity dependence on degree of inter-mode non-equilibrium.
candidates.mechanism_2: Stationary states (both stable and unstable) are computed via fixed-point iteration of a consistency map derived from the PDE and nonlocal interactions. The method is agnostic to dynamical stability—detecting equilibria regardless of whether they attract or repel trajectories. This separates statics (equilibrium existence) from dynamics (stability), enabling discovery of unstable stationary configurations invisible to time-evolution methods.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: The quenched structured coalescent for diploid population models on finite graphs with large migrations and uneven offspring distributions
candidates.mechanism_1: As a system approaches a bifurcation point, convergence to steady state slows dramatically. Near criticality, relaxation time diverges according to universal scaling laws. The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Conditioning on rare large events (quenched dynamics) versus averaging over event realizations (annealed dynamics) yields qualitatively different limiting processes: quenched limits preserve event-specific structure, annealed limits smooth over variability.

candidates.title_1: Multiple timescales in collective motion: daily and intraday upstream fish migration focusing on Feller condition
candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic Limits of Physical Intelligence
candidates.mechanism_1: The ratio between diffusion and drift (Feller condition) determines qualitative migration properties. High diffusion relative to drift creates randomized, intermittent movement patterns. Low ratio produces more deterministic, continuous movement. This ratio acts as a control parameter governing timescale-dependent behavioral transitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Local monomer depletion creates negative feedback between network density and growth. Epiplexity (structural information encoding) and empowerment (control capacity) provide recognition vs. control axes for physical intelligence. Landauer-scale closed-cycle benchmarks require explicit boundary-closure and reset assumptions - without charging for external low-entropy resources, information gain and dissipation decouple.

candidates.title_1: DeXposure-FM: A Time-series, Graph Foundation Model for Credit Exposures and Stability on Decentralized Financial Networks
candidates.title_2: Estimating measures of information processing during cognitive tasks using functional magnetic resonance imaging
candidates.mechanism_1: Token-mediated dependencies create dense inter-component connections. A shock to one component propagates through dependency links causing contagion effects. Network topology and link weights determine the extent and path of cascading failures across the system.
candidates.mechanism_2: Active information storage (within-region retention), transfer entropy (directed flow), and net synergy (redundancy vs. synergy) quantify information processing. Cross mutual information combines resting-state and task data to address limited samples. AIS increases with cognitive load in fronto-parietal regions; TE reveals enhanced directed flows; net synergy shows global redundancy shift.

candidates.title_1: Optimal Learning-Rate Schedules under Functional Scaling Laws: Power Decay and Warmup-Stable-Decay
candidates.title_2: On the Uncertainty of Large Language Model-Based Multi-Agent Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Phase transition in optimal strategy based on task difficulty regime. System exhibits qualitatively different behaviors (power decay vs warmup-stable-decay) separated by sharp threshold determined by ratio of signal learning rate to noise forgetting capacity. Easy-task regime benefits from gradual decay, hard-task regime requires maintaining peak resources until near completion.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multi-agent performance is governed by certainty preference: reducing entropy at any stage for any agent is critical for correct solutions. Uncertainty dynamics are largely determined in the first interaction round, establishing baseline entropy that constrains subsequent evolution. Lower base model entropy during initial problem-solving directly benefits multi-agent outcomes, suggesting initial uncertainty sets persistent constraints on collaborative effectiveness.

candidates.title_1: Coarse-graining and stochastic oscillations in a phenomenological model of cell-size homeostasis
candidates.title_2: Decaying Sensitivity of the Zero Solution for a Class of Nonlinear Optimal Control Problems
candidates.mechanism_1: Cell size feedback operates through size deviations (difference between absolute size and cell-cycle progression). Feedback from size to growth rate and cycle timing creates coupled dynamics. In linear regime, dynamics reduce to stochastically forced harmonic oscillator. Cell-cycle timing and intrinsic fluctuations jointly shape size control strategy. Mechanistic feedback structure may differ from apparent coarse-grained correlations due to noise integration.
candidates.mechanism_2: Localized perturbations in graph-structured systems induce optimal trajectories that decay exponentially with graph distance from perturbation source. Spatial decay arises from interaction topology: influences propagate through network edges but attenuate geometrically with path length. Graph distance acts as effective spatial dimension governing perturbation propagation, with topology imposing decay rate independently of detailed dynamics.

candidates.title_1: Greedy Routing Reachability Games
candidates.title_2: Semiclassical Structure of the Advection--Diffusion Spectrum in Mixed Phase Spaces

Phase-locking of coupled oscillators creates temporal resource partitioning. Plasticity allows dynamic adjustment of activity timing based on competitor presence. Coexistence emerges when plastic responses generate sufficient temporal separation in resource use patterns.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coexisting dynamical regimes generate competing mode families with non-uniform spectral gaps and persistent modal competition: regular regions support long-lived coherent modes, chaotic regions produce rapid mixing, and coupling between regions creates intermediate tunneling modes.

candidates.title_1: Intermittent precipitation and spatial Allee effects drive irregular vegetation patterns in semiarid ecosystems
candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic Limits of Physical Intelligence
candidates.mechanism_1: Intermittent resource pulses interact with positive density dependence (Allee effects) to generate irregular spatial clusters. During favorable pulses, local facilitation enables patch expansion; during scarcity, neighborhood density determines survival. Resilience emerges from spatial covariance and local density rather than total biomass.
candidates.mechanism_2: Local monomer depletion creates negative feedback between network density and growth. Epiplexity (structural information encoding) and empowerment (control capacity) provide recognition vs. control axes for physical intelligence. Landauer-scale closed-cycle benchmarks require explicit boundary-closure and reset assumptions - without charging for external low-entropy resources, information gain and dissipation decouple.

candidates.title_1: PLANET v2.0: A comprehensive Protein-Ligand Affinity Prediction Model Based on Mixture Density Network
candidates.title_2: Disentangling Causal Importance from Emergent Structure in Multi-Expert Orchestration
candidates.mechanism_1: Probabilistic ensemble prediction via mixture density modeling. Instead of predicting single-point outcomes, model represents full probability distribution over possible configurations (contact maps, interaction geometries), then aggregates via mathematical expectation to produce robust predictions that account for uncertainty in binding modes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Expert importance exhibits dual structure: relational importance (routing frequency, interaction centrality) diverges from intrinsic importance (causal influence via gradient attribution). Frequently-routed experts may act as structural hubs with limited functional impact, while sparsely-routed experts can be causally critical. Masking intrinsically-important experts causes disproportionate collapse in interaction topology compared to masking frequent peers, revealing hidden causal dependencies.

candidates.title_1: Compressing Complexity: A Critical Synthesis of Structural, Analytical, and Data-Driven Dimensionality Reduction in Dynamical Networks
candidates.title_2: Graph-Based Audits for Meek Single Transferable Vote Elections
candidates.mechanism_1: Three reduction paradigms form Pareto frontier between computational tractability and physical fidelity: structural coarse-graining (spectral/topological contraction), analytical reduction (moment closures preserving mechanisms), and data-driven reduction (manifold learning prioritizing prediction). Selection governed by no-free-lunch theorem - epistemological trade-off between causal mechanism preservation versus predictive power.
candidates.mechanism_2: Constraining process trajectories to fixed subgraph of possibility space enables efficient verification without full enumeration: defining acceptable path subgraph and verifying containment cheaper than exploring all possibilities.

candidates.title_1: Autodiscover: A reinforcement learning recommendation system for the cold-start imbalance challenge in active learning, powered by graph-aware thompson sampling
candidates.title_2: Estimating measures of information processing during cognitive tasks using functional magnetic resonance imaging
candidates.mechanism_1: Discounted Thompson Sampling dynamically manages portfolio of query strategies in active learning. Agent balances exploration-exploitation under non-stationary review dynamics where strategy utility changes over time. Graph-aware attention learns relational structure while agent adapts strategy selection, mitigating cold-start failures through bootstrapping discovery from minimal labels.
candidates.mechanism_2: Active information storage (within-region retention), transfer entropy (directed flow), and net synergy (redundancy vs. synergy) quantify information processing. Cross mutual information combines resting-state and task data to address limited samples. AIS increases with cognitive load in fronto-parietal regions; TE reveals enhanced directed flows; net synergy shows global redundancy shift.

candidates.title_1: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution
candidates.title_2: Crossing the Functional Desert: Cascade-Driven Assembly and Feasibility Transitions in Early Life
candidates.mechanism_1: Strategy distributions evolve through selection (performance-based survival), innovation (mutation), and environmental perturbation (external shocks). Individual agents adapt using local signals while population composition shifts based on relative fitness. Two-layer adaptation - individual learning plus population-level evolution - determines whether strategies persist, collapse, or form coalitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Functional organization transitions at critical connectivity: below threshold, cascades die locally creating a functional desert (sparse, transient responses); near percolation threshold, system-spanning cascades emerge enabling discriminative responses. Connectivity-driven transition introduces coherence timescales and weak path-dependence into otherwise memoryless exploration. Network dynamics alone soften combinatorial feasibility barriers without requiring specific biochemistry.

candidates.title_1: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
candidates.title_2: Controlling extreme events in neuronal networks: A single driving signal approach
candidates.mechanism_1: Threshold-based resource redistribution creates feedback between network structure and resource allocation ability. Agents below threshold solicit help; helpers contribute fractionally based on relatedness. Higher local density and relational closeness emerge as redistribution-dependent survival creates centralized clusters through cooperative resource sharing.
candidates.mechanism_2: Single driving signal targeting one network node suppresses extreme events network-wide through dominance mechanism. Suppression occurs via frequency decoupling - driven neuron breaks from collective proto-event frequency dynamics, disrupting synchronized extreme event generation. Larger driven subpopulation enables earlier control onset, showing scaling advantage.

candidates.title_1: An Adaptive Differentially Private Federated Learning Framework with Bi-level Optimization
candidates.title_2: History Is Not Enough: An Adaptive Dataflow System for Financial Time-Series Synthesis
candidates.mechanism_1: Local compressed module regularizes representations to constrain gradient variability, mitigating noise amplification in heterogeneous federated learning. Adaptive gradient clipping dynamically adjusts thresholds based on historical statistics to avoid over-clipping. Constraint-aware aggregation suppresses unreliable noise-dominated updates, stabilizing global optimization under differential privacy.
candidates.mechanism_2: Adaptive control loop for data curation under distribution shift. System couples data manipulation module with performance monitor, using gradient-based optimization to continuously adjust curation parameters based on downstream task performance, creating feedback between model outcomes and data generation strategy.

candidates.title_1: Locally Gentle State Certification for High Dimensional Quantum Systems
candidates.title_2: Enabling Large-Scale Channel Sounding for 6G: A Framework for Sparse Sampling and Multipath Component Extraction
candidates.mechanism_1: Measurement gentleness constraint (α-bounded state perturbation) imposes information extraction penalty. Sample complexity scales as d/α² - the trade-off between disturbance and information parallels privacy mechanisms. Gentler measurements require more samples but preserve quantum state for reuse, creating fundamental efficiency-preservation trade-off.
candidates.mechanism_2: Sparse non-uniform sampling with likelihood-based reconstruction. System uses sparse irregular sampling pattern (avoiding dense uniform grid that requires prohibitive measurement count), then reconstructs full channel information via likelihood-rectified multipath component extraction. Trades direct measurement completeness for computational inference, dramatically reducing measurement overhead while maintaining characterization fidelity.

candidates.title_1: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution
candidates.title_2: Dr. Kernel: Reinforcement Learning Done Right for Triton Kernel Generations
candidates.mechanism_1: Strategy distributions evolve through selection (performance-based survival), innovation (mutation), and environmental perturbation (external shocks). Individual agents adapt using local signals while population composition shifts based on relative fitness. Two-layer adaptation - individual learning plus population-level evolution - determines whether strategies persist, collapse, or form coalitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Turn-level Reinforce-Leave-One-Out provides unbiased advantage estimation for multi-turn RL by excluding self from baseline. Prevents biased policy gradient from self-inclusion in GRPO. Profiling-based rewards and rejection sampling overcome lazy optimization where models hack training rewards prioritizing trivial correctness over meaningful optimization. Multi-turn mismatch correction ensures training stability.

candidates.title_1: Unveiling Scaling Behaviors in Molecular Language Models: Effects of Model Size, Data, and Representation
candidates.title_2: Fast Private Adaptive Query Answering for Large Data Domains
candidates.mechanism_1: Scaling behavior depends jointly on model capacity, training data volume, and input representation structure: different representations yield different scaling exponents, making representation choice as critical as model size for performance.
candidates.mechanism_2: Incremental residual representations with lazy evaluation and adaptive resource allocation improve efficiency-accuracy tradeoffs: computing only changed components, deferring updates until needed, and dynamically allocating budget reduce redundant computation.

candidates.title_1: All-Atom GPCR-Ligand Simulation via Residual Isometric Latent Flow
candidates.title_2: Fast Private Adaptive Query Answering for Large Data Domains
candidates.mechanism_1: Residual dynamics modeling via decoupling static topology from temporal fluctuations. System learns isometric latent representation preserving geometric constraints (static topology), then models temporal evolution via relative displacements anchored to initial structure rather than absolute coordinates. Separates invariant structural relationships from dynamic conformational changes, improving computational efficiency while maintaining physical fidelity.
candidates.mechanism_2: Incremental residual representations with lazy evaluation and adaptive resource allocation improve efficiency-accuracy tradeoffs: computing only changed components, deferring updates until needed, and dynamically allocating budget reduce redundant computation.

candidates.title_1: Discrete dynamical systems with scaling and inversion symmetries
candidates.title_2: Habitat heterogeneity and dispersal network structure as drivers of metacommunity dynamics

Near fixed points, small perturbations grow exponentially (positive Lyapunov exponent) causing sensitive dependence. Trajectories confined to fractal attractor with non-integer dimension. Chaotic regime characterized by scaling laws and self-similarity across scales.
candidates.mechanism_2: Effective dispersal kernel encodes both microscopic dynamical parameters and network topology in coarse-grained metacommunity model. Metapopulation capacity generalizes to non-uniform local extinction rates. Stochasticity from finite carrying capacities yields reduced one-dimensional description with universal finite-size scaling laws for extinction times. Homogeneous environments require fine-tuned marginally stable coexistence to avoid monodominance.

candidates.title_1: Role of the ocean for fast atmospheric evolution revealed by machine learning
candidates.title_2: ProbFM: Probabilistic Time Series Foundation Model with Uncertainty Decomposition
candidates.mechanism_1: Atmospheric emulators without ocean inputs implicitly infer ocean conditions from atmospheric states alone. Forecast errors over oceans reveal which air-sea information is derivable from atmosphere (captured implicitly) versus which requires explicit ocean data (cannot be inferred). Error-property relationships identify regions where ocean independently influences atmosphere on fast timescales, exposing limits of atmosphere-only inference and highlighting irreducible ocean-atmosphere coupling.
candidates.mechanism_2: Deep Evidential Regression decomposes uncertainty into epistemic (model uncertainty) and aleatoric (data noise) components through higher-order evidence learning. Rather than pre-specifying distributions or requiring sampling, the model learns optimal uncertainty representations by treating prediction as distribution over distributions. Single-pass inference yields explicit epistemic-aleatoric separation, enabling principled uncertainty quantification without additional computational cost.

candidates.title_1: Thermodynamic Limits of Physical Intelligence
candidates.title_2: A generalized work theorem for stopped stochastic chemical reaction networks
candidates.mechanism_1: Local monomer depletion creates negative feedback between network density and growth. Epiplexity (structural information encoding) and empowerment (control capacity) provide recognition vs. control axes for physical intelligence. Landauer-scale closed-cycle benchmarks require explicit boundary-closure and reset assumptions - without charging for external low-entropy resources, information gain and dissipation decouple.
candidates.mechanism_2: Chemical reaction networks exhibit martingale structure in generalized entropy without requiring detailed balance. Martingale properties emerge directly from reaction propensity structure: the jump process compensated with appropriate drift becomes a zero-mean stochastic process. This enables work theorems for arbitrary stopping times and singular initial conditions, generalizing thermodynamic relations beyond equilibrium systems.

candidates.title_1: Manipulation in Prediction Markets: An Agent-based Modeling Experiment
candidates.title_2: Autodiscover: A reinforcement learning recommendation system for the cold-start imbalance challenge in active learning, powered by graph-aware thompson sampling
candidates.mechanism_1: Manipulators with high budgets attempt to distort prediction market prices. Informed traders with correct beliefs observe price distortions and increase their opposing bets. Market depth and information heterogeneity determine manipulation effectiveness. When information is dispersed, manipulation can temporarily move prices, but informed arbitrage eventually corrects mispricing. Manipulator budget and trader information quality create a competitive dynamic.
candidates.mechanism_2: Discounted Thompson Sampling dynamically manages portfolio of query strategies in active learning. Agent balances exploration-exploitation under non-stationary review dynamics where strategy utility changes over time. Graph-aware attention learns relational structure while agent adapts strategy selection, mitigating cold-start failures through bootstrapping discovery from minimal labels.

candidates.title_1: Cross-feeding yields high-dimensional chaos and coexistence of species beyond exclusion principle
candidates.title_2: Game-Theoretic and Algorithmic Analyses of Multi-Agent Routing under Crossing Costs
candidates.mechanism_1: Species cross-feed through metabolite leakage and uptake. Competitive uptake of leaked chemicals creates coupled population-chemical dynamics. Network structure determines attractor types: fixed points, limit cycles, low-dimensional chaos, or high-dimensional chaos. High-dimensional chaos enables coexistence beyond competitive exclusion limits through intermittent switching among quasi-stationary states. Chemical dynamics explore high-dimensional space while populations switch intermittently.
candidates.mechanism_2: Crossing cost (product of opposing-direction agent counts) quantifies conflict risk in asynchronous multi-agent routing. Pure Nash equilibria exist when agents minimize individual crossing exposure. Equilibrium emergence dynamics depend on network structure - general case is PLS-complete, but polynomial-time solvable under mild structural conditions.

candidates.title_1: Emergent structures in coupled opinion and network dynamics
candidates.title_2: Game-Theoretic and Algorithmic Analyses of Multi-Agent Routing under Crossing Costs
candidates.mechanism_1: Individuals' opinions and network edge weights coevolve through coupled dynamics. Interaction strength depends on opinion distance. Similar opinions strengthen network connections. Connection strength amplifies opinion influence. This creates feedback between opinion convergence and network structure formation. Interaction function form determines emergent structures and stability.
candidates.mechanism_2: Crossing cost (product of opposing-direction agent counts) quantifies conflict risk in asynchronous multi-agent routing. Pure Nash equilibria exist when agents minimize individual crossing exposure. Equilibrium emergence dynamics depend on network structure - general case is PLS-complete, but polynomial-time solvable under mild structural conditions.

candidates.title_1: Mathematical Modeling of Common-Pool Resources: A Comprehensive Review of Bioeconomics, Strategic Interaction, and Complex Adaptive Systems
candidates.title_2: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Paradigm shift from static optimization to dynamic resilience in commons management. Early deterministic bioeconomic models established individual-collective efficiency tension. Ostrom turn integrated institutional monitoring and sanctions into game theory. Evolutionary dynamics and behavioral economics relaxed rationality. Stochastic models capture spatial heterogeneity and noise-induced regime shifts with early warning signals.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coupled multi-timescale dynamics with threshold-based control transition. Fast epidemiological process coupled to slow ecological oscillation, where amplitude of slow cycle determines disease persistence via threshold (ecological reproduction number). Natural control sufficient above threshold; below threshold requires engineered intervention to navigate both timescales simultaneously.

candidates.title_1: Controlling extreme events in neuronal networks: A single driving signal approach
candidates.title_2: On the occupation measure of evolution models with vanishing mutations
candidates.mechanism_1: A single driving signal applied to one network component suppresses extreme events throughout the system. In coupled components, drive breaks phase-locking between elements. In networked systems, drive disrupts protoevent frequency dynamics causing frequency decoupling that prevents extreme event cascades.
candidates.mechanism_2: Collective oscillations in many-body systems mediate nonlinear wave mixing without requiring strong single-particle nonlinearity. Coherent many-body response creates effective nonlinearity through collective mode coupling. Weak individual interactions amplified by collective dynamics generate strong wave mixing. Effective interaction strength scales with system size or coupling density.

candidates.title_1: Distinguishable spreading dynamics in microbial communities
candidates.title_2: Optimal Control Strategies for Epidemic Dynamics: Integrating SIR-SI and Lotka--Volterra Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Proliferation limitations determine spreading dynamics. Growth arrest causes superlinear spreading at reduced rate. Pressure-limited growth produces linear constant-speed spreading. Nutrient-limited growth exhibits phase transition: superlinear when nutrient supply is high, sublinear when depleted. Nutrient supply and conversion efficiency determine phase boundary. Spreading rate distinguishes dominant limitation type.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coupled multi-timescale dynamics with threshold-based control transition. Fast epidemiological process coupled to slow ecological oscillation, where amplitude of slow cycle determines disease persistence via threshold (ecological reproduction number). candidates.title_1: The Great Filter hypothesis -- a new Great Filter?
candidates.title_2: EGSS: Entropy-guided Stepwise Scaling for Reliable Software Engineering
candidates.mechanism_1: Resource allocation trade-off between immune repertoire diversity and clone expansion. Broad repertoire enables better pathogen recognition but limits per-clone resources. Focused expansion provides strong response to known pathogens but reduces diversity. Optimal strategy depends on pathogen encounter rate and diversity - high diversity environments favor broad repertoires despite weaker per-clone responses.
candidates.mechanism_2: Test-time scaling balances efficiency and effectiveness through entropy-guided adaptive search: high-entropy (uncertain) states trigger expanded search, while low-entropy states terminate early. Test-suite augmentation provides robust candidate selection. The framework dynamically adjusts ensemble size based on current uncertainty, avoiding excessive computation in confident regions while allocating resources to ambiguous cases.

candidates.title_1: An attention economy model of co-evolution between content quality and audience selectivity
candidates.title_2: Impulsive Release Strategies for Wolbachia-Infected Mosquitoes under Temperature-Induced Infection Loss
candidates.mechanism_1: Seed dormancy as bet-hedging strategy in temporally fluctuating environments. Germination fraction trades off current reproduction against future survival through dormant seed bank. Optimal dormancy level depends on environmental variability - higher variance favors increased dormancy. Multi-year averaging through seed bank buffers against temporal unpredictability.
candidates.mechanism_2: Impulsive periodic intervention under environmental stress. System alternates between autonomous dynamics and discrete intervention events (periodic releases), with environmental perturbations (temperature stress) potentially reversing intervention effects. Success threshold depends on balancing intervention frequency, stress magnitude, and fitness costs to maintain desired state despite continuous environmental pressure.

candidates.title_2: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution

Population dynamics alter size distributions compared to single lineages - exponential population growth changes the effective size control measured in constant-volume experiments. Extrinsic growth noise and population structure jointly determine observed size distributions.

Fast switching increases information transmission while slow switching filters noise.

candidates.mechanism_1: Reciprocal group dynamics and behavioral inertia drive cooperation levels in groups. Cooperation depends on observed group behavior patterns rather than the identity of participants. These normative mechanisms operate identically regardless of agent type, creating stable cooperation patterns through behavioral feedback.
candidates.mechanism_2: Behavioral heterogeneity with homophily creates resurgence dynamics near critical thresholds: diverse risk responses combined with preferential interaction among similar types produces initial decline followed by secondary surge as low-risk subpopulation becomes infected.

candidates.title_1: From semantic memory to collective creativity: A generative cognitive foundation for social creativity models
candidates.title_2: Group Selection as a Safeguard Against AI Substitution
candidates.mechanism_1: Individual semantic network topology determines ideational breadth. When agents exchange ideation traces, lower initial overlap predicts larger stimulation gains. Shared inspiration sources create network-level redundancy, forming feedback between individual cognitive structure and collective outcomes.
candidates.mechanism_2: AI use reduces cultural variance in populations. Under individual selection, agents relying heavily on AI (substitutes) outcompete those using AI as complement, despite reducing variance more. Group selection can favor agents that maintain variance through complementary AI use when group boundaries are strong, creating selection-level competition.

candidates.title_1: Higher-order adaptive behaviors outperform pairwise strategies in mitigating contagion dynamics
candidates.title_2: Low-Dimensional Interaction Spaces Impose Geometric Constraints On Collective Organization
candidates.mechanism_1: Higher-order information creates heterogeneous risk perception targeting structural hubs and high-participation nodes, preventing contagion exploitation of these critical paths at lower social cost than uniform interventions.
candidates.mechanism_2: When effective interactions among system components compress into low-dimensional interaction space, global organization is governed by geometric constraints rather than detailed dynamics. Low interaction dimensionality imposes upper bounds on number, separability, and robustness of collective organizations. Many macroscopic organizations are excluded a priori even when locally-compatible interactions exist, shifting explanation from generative mechanisms to structural impossibility.

candidates.title_1: Distributed delay stabilizes bistable genetic networks
candidates.title_2: Imperfect Turing Patterns: Diffusiophoretic Assembly of Hard Spheres via Reaction-Diffusion Instabilities
candidates.mechanism_1: Protein production involves delayed multi-step process (transcription, translation, folding, oligomerization). Delay is distributed (noisy) due to stochastic process durations. Increasing delay noise dramatically stabilizes metastable states in bistable circuits. Mean residence times in metastable states increase with delay distribution width. Distributed delay prevents unwanted switching caused by small fluctuations while allowing controlled transitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multi-scale pattern formation via coupled reaction-diffusion and particle assembly. Classical Turing mechanism (single length scale from reaction-diffusion balance) coupled to finite-size particle assembly driven by background chemical gradient (diffusiophoresis) plus particle-particle interactions. Introduces additional control parameters (particle size, Péclet number, interaction strength) creating imperfections, grain textures, and multi-scale structures.

candidates.title_1: Stable Time Series Prediction of Enterprise Carbon Emissions Based on Causal Inference
candidates.title_2: Dual Mind World Model Inspired Network Digital Twin for Access Scheduling
candidates.mechanism_1: Causal stable features (robust to external perturbations, stable long-term effects) extracted from multi-environment samples across policies and regions. Risk consistency constraints identify invariant causal relationships unaffected by distribution shifts. Adaptive normalization and sample reweighting dynamically correct temporal non-stationarity from economic fluctuations and policy transitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Adaptive control emerges from combining two anticipatory modes: short-horizon predictive planning (data-driven future state estimation) and symbolic model-based rollout (interpretable scenario simulation). The scheduler adjusts decisions by integrating near-future probabilistic forecasts with longer-horizon symbolic what-if analysis, enabling both reactive adaptation and strategic foresight without requiring perfect predictions.

candidates.title_1: Learning to Share: Selective Memory for Efficient Parallel Agentic Systems
candidates.title_2: PhageMind: Generalized Strain-level Phage Host Range Prediction via Meta-learning

candidates.mechanism_2: Transfer learning with structured graph representations enables few-shot adaptation across related domains by identifying shared interaction principles from well-studied systems and rapidly adapting to new contexts with minimal training data.

candidates.mechanism_2: Local monomer depletion from network growth creates negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Higher density causes faster monomer consumption and slower growth. Multiple networks sharing finite monomer pool reach steady states through self-regulation. candidates.title_1: Threshold Resource Redistribution in Spatially-Structured Kinship Networks
candidates.title_2: Social Catalysts, Not Moral Agents: The Illusion of Alignment in LLM Societies
candidates.mechanism_1: Threshold-based resource redistribution creates feedback between network structure and resource allocation ability. Agents below threshold solicit help; helpers contribute fractionally based on relatedness. Higher local density and relational closeness emerge as redistribution-dependent survival creates centralized clusters through cooperative resource sharing.
candidates.mechanism_2: External behavioral anchors induce strategic compliance and cognitive offloading without genuine norm internalization: agents mimic anchor behavior locally to reduce cognitive load, but revert to self-interested behavior when anchors absent or unobservable.

candidates.title_1: Game-Theoretic and Algorithmic Analyses of Multi-Agent Routing under Crossing Costs
candidates.title_2: Decaying Sensitivity of the Zero Solution for a Class of Nonlinear Optimal Control Problems
candidates.mechanism_1: Crossing cost (product of opposing-direction agent counts) quantifies conflict risk in asynchronous multi-agent routing. Pure Nash equilibria exist when agents minimize individual crossing exposure. Equilibrium emergence dynamics depend on network structure - general case is PLS-complete, but polynomial-time solvable under mild structural conditions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Localized perturbations in graph-structured systems induce optimal trajectories that decay exponentially with graph distance from perturbation source. Spatial decay arises from interaction topology: influences propagate through network edges but attenuate geometrically with path length. Graph distance acts as effective spatial dimension governing perturbation propagation, with topology imposing decay rate independently of detailed dynamics.

candidates.title_1: Equilibrium Propagation for Non-Conservative Systems
candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic Origin of Degree-Day Scaling in Phase-Change Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Augmented state space with corrective dynamics extends equilibrium-based learning to non-conservative systems: adding auxiliary variables and non-reciprocal correction terms to learning dynamics recovers exact gradients despite broken energy conservation.
candidates.mechanism_2: Phase transitions impose topological constraints that mask energetic fluctuations. Introducing a latent temperature (counterfactual unconstrained trajectory) resolves information loss. Energy conservation enforces duality: total latent heat dissipated equals accumulated exceedance of latent temperature above melting point. This duality is mathematically equivalent to Wasserstein-1 distance (optimal transport) between latent and observed trajectories, with phase change emerging as transport that projects continuous energy variability onto constrained thermodynamic boundaries.

candidates.title_1: Habitat heterogeneity and dispersal network structure as drivers of metacommunity dynamics
candidates.title_2: Thermodynamic cost-controllability tradeoff in metabolic currency coupling

candidates.mechanism_2: Controllability-efficiency tradeoff in coupled resource management: independent regulation of multiple coupled resources requires balanced abundances to prevent cross-interference, but balanced states incur higher thermodynamic costs through increased entropy production.

candidates.title_1: Distinguishable spreading dynamics in microbial communities
candidates.title_2: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks in a shared and finite pool of monomers

Nutrient supply and conversion efficiency determine phase boundary. Spreading rate distinguishes dominant limitation type.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multiple branched actin networks compete for shared monomer pool. Network growth locally depletes monomers creating negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Local depletion couples network growth rates through shared resource. Under weak competition, networks coexist at steady state. Under strong competition, selection replaces coexistence - fastest-growing network excludes others. Competition strength determined by monomer availability and consumption rates.

candidates.title_1: Fully Automated Adaptive Parameter Selection for 3-D High-order Nyström Boundary Integral Equation Methods
candidates.title_2: A Dual-Loop Agent Framework for Automated Vulnerability Reproduction

candidates.mechanism_2: Vulnerability reproduction employs failure-type-specific routing: tactical failures (code-level bugs) route to tactical loop for implementation refinement, while strategic failures (incorrect attack direction) route to strategic loop for approach replanning. This dual-loop architecture separates exploration of attack space from execution details, preventing unproductive debugging when the fundamental approach is wrong. Adaptive routing matches remediation depth to failure cause.

candidates.title_1: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution
candidates.title_2: Inverse Depth Scaling From Most Layers Being Similar

candidates.mechanism_2: Loss scales inversely with depth due to functionally similar layers reducing error through ensemble averaging rather than compositional learning. Residual architecture bias combined with incompatible target functions produces inefficient yet robust regime. candidates.title_2: Heterogeneity dominates irreversibility in random Markov models

candidates.mechanism_2: Markov dynamics combine heterogeneity and asymmetry (broken detailed balance). Heterogeneity parameter controls transition rate variability. Asymmetry parameter controls forward-backward correlation. Critical locus emerges where relaxation times diverge. Entropy production and predictive information depend strongly on heterogeneity but weakly on asymmetry. Near criticality, small heterogeneity changes cause large dynamical shifts.

candidates.mechanism_2: Multi-agent performance is governed by certainty preference: reducing entropy at any stage for any agent is critical for correct solutions. Uncertainty dynamics are largely determined in the first interaction round, establishing baseline entropy that constrains subsequent evolution. Lower base model entropy during initial problem-solving directly benefits multi-agent outcomes, suggesting initial uncertainty sets persistent constraints on collaborative effectiveness.

candidates.title_1: Mathematical Modeling of Common-Pool Resources: A Comprehensive Review of Bioeconomics, Strategic Interaction, and Complex Adaptive Systems

Early deterministic bioeconomic models established individual-collective efficiency tension. Ostrom turn integrated institutional monitoring and sanctions into game theory. Evolutionary dynamics and behavioral economics relaxed rationality. Stochastic models capture spatial heterogeneity and noise-induced regime shifts with early warning signals.
candidates.mechanism_2: Higher-order information creates heterogeneous risk perception targeting structural hubs and high-participation nodes, preventing contagion exploitation of these critical paths at lower social cost than uniform interventions.

candidates.title_1: Heterogeneity dominates irreversibility in random Markov models
candidates.title_2: Advancing Opinion Dynamics Modeling with Neural Diffusion-Convection-Reaction Equation
candidates.mechanism_1: Markov dynamics combine heterogeneity and asymmetry (broken detailed balance). Heterogeneity parameter controls transition rate variability. Asymmetry parameter controls forward-backward correlation. Critical locus emerges where relaxation times diverge. Entropy production and predictive information depend strongly on heterogeneity but weakly on asymmetry. Near criticality, small heterogeneity changes cause large dynamical shifts.
candidates.mechanism_2: Opinion evolution emerges from three coupled processes: diffusion (local influence spreading), convection (directional opinion flow driven by global trends), and reaction (endogenous opinion change). Each level operates at distinct scales—local peer-to-peer, global population-wide, and individual internal—that interact through multi-scale coupling. The system exhibits dynamics from interacting particle theory projected onto opinion space.

candidates.title_1: Indirect Reciprocity with Environmental Feedback
candidates.title_2: DSB: Dynamic Sliding Block Scheduling for Diffusion LLMs
candidates.mechanism_1: Individual behaviors shape reputation through social norms while simultaneously affecting collective resource levels. Environmental changes alter payoff structures, creating feedback between strategic behavior and resource dynamics. Reputation-based cooperation interacts with ecological constraints - cooperative behaviors deplete or enhance shared resources, which then reshape the incentives for future cooperation.
candidates.mechanism_2: Dynamic resource allocation adapts commitment timing to local uncertainty: allocating more processing to uncertain regions while quickly committing to certain regions avoids premature decisions and improves both quality and efficiency.

candidates.title_1: An Adaptive Differentially Private Federated Learning Framework with Bi-level Optimization
candidates.title_2: All-Atom GPCR-Ligand Simulation via Residual Isometric Latent Flow
candidates.mechanism_1: Local compressed module regularizes representations to constrain gradient variability, mitigating noise amplification in heterogeneous federated learning. Adaptive gradient clipping dynamically adjusts thresholds based on historical statistics to avoid over-clipping. Constraint-aware aggregation suppresses unreliable noise-dominated updates, stabilizing global optimization under differential privacy.
candidates.mechanism_2: Residual dynamics modeling via decoupling static topology from temporal fluctuations. System learns isometric latent representation preserving geometric constraints (static topology), then models temporal evolution via relative displacements anchored to initial structure rather than absolute coordinates. Separates invariant structural relationships from dynamic conformational changes, improving computational efficiency while maintaining physical fidelity.

candidates.title_1: Impact of seed node position on network robustness under localized attacks
candidates.title_2: A theory for coexistence and selection of branched actin networks in a shared and finite pool of monomers
candidates.mechanism_1: Localized damage initiates at a seed node and propagates to neighbors. The structural position of the seed node (local connectivity and topology) amplifies or dampens damage progression. Cumulative link severing during attack progression depends critically on seed node characteristics rather than average network properties.
candidates.mechanism_2: Multiple branched actin networks compete for shared monomer pool. Network growth locally depletes monomers creating negative feedback between network density and growth rate. Local depletion couples network growth rates through shared resource. Under weak competition, networks coexist at steady state. Under strong competition, selection replaces coexistence - fastest-growing network excludes others. Competition strength determined by monomer availability and consumption rates.

candidates.title_1: Coarse-graining and stochastic oscillations in a phenomenological model of cell-size homeostasis
candidates.title_2: Effect of higher-order interactions on noisy majority-rule dynamics with random group sizes
candidates.mechanism_1: Cell size feedback operates through size deviations (difference between absolute size and cell-cycle progression). Feedback from size to growth rate and cycle timing creates coupled dynamics. In linear regime, dynamics reduce to stochastically forced harmonic oscillator. Cell-cycle timing and intrinsic fluctuations jointly shape size control strategy. Mechanistic feedback structure may differ from apparent coarse-grained correlations due to noise integration.
candidates.mechanism_2: Variable group sizes in majority-rule dynamics create heterogeneous influence through effective majority leverage. Rare large-group events can realign substantial population fractions. Critical threshold for independence depends on group-size distribution - heavy-tailed distributions enhance robustness to disorder through occasional macroscopic coordination events.

candidates.title_1: Thermodynamic Limits of Physical Intelligence
candidates.title_2: Neural Ordinary Differential Equations for Simulating Metabolic Pathway Dynamics from Time-Series Multiomics Data
candidates.mechanism_1: Local monomer depletion creates negative feedback between network density and growth. Epiplexity (structural information encoding) and empowerment (control capacity) provide recognition vs. control axes for physical intelligence. Landauer-scale closed-cycle benchmarks require explicit boundary-closure and reset assumptions - without charging for external low-entropy resources, information gain and dissipation decouple.
candidates.mechanism_2: Proteome-metabolome dynamics are modeled as continuous interplay via Neural ODEs. Rather than requiring pre-specified mechanistic knowledge, NODEs infer latent interaction structure directly from time-series multiomics data. Learned continuous dynamics enable simulation of temporal trajectories and anticipation of intervention effects, capturing complex feedback between protein expression and metabolite concentrations without manually encoding pathway topology.

candidates.title_1: Chaotic Dynamics in Extremal Black Holes: A Challenge to the Chaos Bound
candidates.title_2: Semiclassical Structure of the Advection--Diffusion Spectrum in Mixed Phase Spaces
candidates.mechanism_1: Particle motion in extremal configurations exhibits positive Lyapunov exponents indicating sensitivity to initial conditions. Chaos persists even at zero temperature. System parameters (spin, charge) modulate chaos strength - increasing one parameter strengthens chaotic behavior while the other weakens it.
candidates.mechanism_2: Coexisting dynamical regimes generate competing mode families with non-uniform spectral gaps and persistent modal competition: regular regions support long-lived coherent modes, chaotic regions produce rapid mixing, and coupling between regions creates intermediate tunneling modes.

candidates.title_1: Full-Covariance Chemical Langevin Predator--Prey Diffusion with Absorbing Boundaries
candidates.title_2: Understanding the temperature response of biological systems: Part II -- Network-level mechanisms and emergent dynamics
candidates.mechanism_1: Predation creates event-level coupling through biomass conversion: predation-conversion increment (-1,+1) induces strictly negative cross-covariance between prey and predator populations. This mechanistic coupling cannot be captured by diagonal (independent) noise. The coupled dynamics arise from the irreducible stochastic structure of predation events, where prey loss simultaneously causes predator gain, creating intrinsic negative correlation in population fluctuations.
candidates.mechanism_2: Individual Arrhenius-like temperature dependence at reaction level transforms into non-Arrhenius scaling, thermal limits, and temperature compensation at network level. Coupled biochemical reactions with temperature-modulated kinetics exhibit emergent system-level temperature response curves that differ from component behaviors. Network coupling creates effective nonlinearities and collective constraints, transforming simple exponential dependencies into complex organism-level thermal responses.

candidates.title_1: PLANET v2.0: A comprehensive Protein-Ligand Affinity Prediction Model Based on Mixture Density Network
candidates.title_2: WADEPre: A Wavelet-based Decomposition Model for Extreme Precipitation Nowcasting with Multi-Scale Learning
candidates.mechanism_1: Probabilistic ensemble prediction via mixture density modeling. Instead of predicting single-point outcomes, model represents full probability distribution over possible configurations (contact maps, interaction geometries), then aggregates via mathematical expectation to produce robust predictions that account for uncertainty in binding modes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Extreme precipitation exhibits multi-scale structure requiring decoupled modeling. Wavelet decomposition separates low-frequency advection (stable, deterministic drift) from high-frequency convection (stochastic, transient singularities). An approximation network models deterministic trends, isolating them from regression-to-mean bias. A detail network captures spatially-localized stochastic fluctuations. Refiner module dynamically reconstructs these decoupled components, preserving extreme values and sharp boundaries lost in standard pixel-wise regression.

candidates.title_1: Estimating measures of information processing during cognitive tasks using functional magnetic resonance imaging
candidates.title_2: ROMAN: Reward-Orchestrated Multi-Head Attention Network for Autonomous Driving System Testing
candidates.mechanism_1: Active information storage (within-region retention), transfer entropy (directed flow), and net synergy (redundancy vs. synergy) quantify information processing. Cross mutual information combines resting-state and task data to address limited samples. AIS increases with cognitive load in fronto-parietal regions; TE reveals enhanced directed flows; net synergy shows global redundancy shift.
candidates.mechanism_2: Reward-orchestrated multi-head attention for high-risk scenario generation. Multiple attention heads each explore different dimension of scenario space (traffic law compliance, environmental complexity, safety risk), with reward function orchestrating attention allocation to prioritize generation of rare critical edge cases that expose system vulnerabilities rather than common benign scenarios.

candidates.title_1: A phenomenological description of critical slowing down at period-doubling bifurcations
candidates.title_2: On the occupation measure of evolution models with vanishing mutations
candidates.mechanism_1: As a system approaches a bifurcation point, convergence to steady state slows dramatically. Near criticality, relaxation time diverges according to universal scaling laws. The system exhibits characteristic critical exponents that govern short-time behavior, asymptotic decay, and crossover between regimes.
candidates.mechanism_2: Collective oscillations in many-body systems mediate nonlinear wave mixing without requiring strong single-particle nonlinearity. Coherent many-body response creates effective nonlinearity through collective mode coupling. Weak individual interactions amplified by collective dynamics generate strong wave mixing. Effective interaction strength scales with system size or coupling density.

candidates.title_1: Uncertainty in Island-based Ecosystem Services and Climate Change
candidates.title_2: How adaptation to food resources and death rates shape oscillatory dynamics in a microbial population
candidates.mechanism_1: Transmission rate increases with infected density. Recovery rate decreases infection duration. When transmission exceeds recovery (R0>1), epidemic spreads exponentially. Vaccination reduces susceptible population shifting R0 below 1. Spatial heterogeneity creates local pockets where R0 varies.
candidates.mechanism_2: Microbes adapt to food supply while experiencing death. Oscillations emerge when adaptation timescale exceeds death timescale. Consumer-resource dynamics couple population growth to substrate replenishment. Multiple timescale interactions determine stability - slow adaptation relative to death enables oscillatory behavior. Necromass recycling and complementary food sources dampen oscillations by facilitating growth.

candidates.title_1: Fully Automated Adaptive Parameter Selection for 3-D High-order Nyström Boundary Integral Equation Methods
candidates.title_2: Dual Mind World Model Inspired Network Digital Twin for Access Scheduling
candidates.mechanism_1: Unified adaptive schemes eliminate manual parameter tuning while maintaining accuracy across diverse problem instances: automatic error-driven refinement of resolution and interaction distances adapts to local geometric complexity.
candidates.mechanism_2: Adaptive control emerges from combining two anticipatory modes: short-horizon predictive planning (data-driven future state estimation) and symbolic model-based rollout (interpretable scenario simulation). The scheduler adjusts decisions by integrating near-future probabilistic forecasts with longer-horizon symbolic what-if analysis, enabling both reactive adaptation and strategic foresight without requiring perfect predictions.

candidates.title_1: Multiple timescales in collective motion: daily and intraday upstream fish migration focusing on Feller condition
candidates.title_2: On Path-based Marginal Cost of Heterogeneous Traffic Flow for General Networks
candidates.mechanism_1: The ratio between diffusion and drift (Feller condition) determines qualitative migration properties. High diffusion relative to drift creates randomized, intermittent movement patterns. Low ratio produces more deterministic, continuous movement. This ratio acts as a control parameter governing timescale-dependent behavioral transitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Path marginal cost in heterogeneous traffic decomposes into intra-class effects (within vehicle type) and inter-class effects (cross-type interactions). Conversion factors derived from heterogeneous link dynamics explicitly model competitive relationships between vehicle classes. Non-differentiability emerges when mixed flow approaches system optimum, as flow competition shifts from continuous to threshold-based at equilibrium.

candidates.title_1: To clean or not to clean: The free-rider problem in sequentially shared resources
candidates.title_2: Learning to Share: Selective Memory for Efficient Parallel Agentic Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Shared resource use creates a cooperation dilemma with cleaning costs, contamination risk, and social incentives forming competing pressures. Cleaning cost primarily determines stability of altruistic behavior. The system exhibits multi-stability and hysteresis - small parameter changes can cause abrupt shifts between cooperation and free-riding equilibria.
candidates.mechanism_2: Learned selective information sharing across parallel exploration processes. Multiple independent teams explore different solution trajectories with learned controller deciding which intermediate results to place in globally-accessible shared memory. Balances exploration diversity (parallel independence) against computational efficiency (reuse of overlapping sub-solutions), using stepwise credit assignment to identify globally useful information.

candidates.title_1: Discrete dynamical systems with scaling and inversion symmetries
candidates.title_2: All-Atom GPCR-Ligand Simulation via Residual Isometric Latent Flow
candidates.mechanism_1: System state evolves discretely through iterated function. Scaling symmetry preserves dynamics under magnification/contraction. Near fixed points, small perturbations grow exponentially (positive Lyapunov exponent) causing sensitive dependence. Trajectories confined to fractal attractor with non-integer dimension. Chaotic regime characterized by scaling laws and self-similarity across scales.
candidates.mechanism_2: Residual dynamics modeling via decoupling static topology from temporal fluctuations. System learns isometric latent representation preserving geometric constraints (static topology), then models temporal evolution via relative displacements anchored to initial structure rather than absolute coordinates. candidates.title_2: EGSS: Entropy-guided Stepwise Scaling for Reliable Software Engineering
candidates.mechanism_1: Strategy distributions evolve through selection (performance-based survival), innovation (mutation), and environmental perturbation (external shocks). Individual agents adapt using local signals while population composition shifts based on relative fitness. Two-layer adaptation - individual learning plus population-level evolution - determines whether strategies persist, collapse, or form coalitions.
candidates.mechanism_2: Test-time scaling balances efficiency and effectiveness through entropy-guided adaptive search: high-entropy (uncertain) states trigger expanded search, while low-entropy states terminate early. Test-suite augmentation provides robust candidate selection. The framework dynamically adjusts ensemble size based on current uncertainty, avoiding excessive computation in confident regions while allocating resources to ambiguous cases.

candidates.title_1: Controlling extreme events in neuronal networks: A single driving signal approach
candidates.title_2: AEGPO: Adaptive Entropy-Guided Policy Optimization for Diffusion Models
candidates.mechanism_1: Single driving signal targeting one network node suppresses extreme events network-wide through dominance mechanism. Suppression occurs via frequency decoupling - driven neuron breaks from collective proto-event frequency dynamics, disrupting synchronized extreme event generation. Larger driven subpopulation enables earlier control onset, showing scaling advantage.
candidates.mechanism_2: Dual-signal adaptive resource allocation using entropy as proxy for learning value. Global level: relative entropy change identifies high-value samples for prioritized exploration. Local level: absolute entropy peaks identify critical moments within each trajectory. Concentrates computation where information gain is highest rather than uniform distribution.

candidates.title_1: Game-Theoretic and Algorithmic Analyses of Multi-Agent Routing under Crossing Costs
candidates.title_2: Mathematical Modeling of Common-Pool Resources: A Comprehensive Review of Bioeconomics, Strategic Interaction, and Complex Adaptive Systems
candidates.mechanism_1: Crossing cost (product of opposing-direction agent counts) quantifies conflict risk in asynchronous multi-agent routing. Pure Nash equilibria exist when agents minimize individual crossing exposure. Equilibrium emergence dynamics depend on network structure - general case is PLS-complete, but polynomial-time solvable under mild structural conditions.

Vaccination reduces susceptible population shifting R0 below 1. Spatial heterogeneity creates local pockets where R0 varies.
candidates.mechanism_2: Technology adoption spreads through spatial and network channels. Spatial spillovers and network externalities interact multiplicatively - nearby adoption and connected peer adoption amplify each other. Cumulative adoption pressure accumulates along stochastic paths through spatial-network space. Network position amplifies or dampens spatial effects, creating non-linear adoption dynamics.

candidates.title_1: Strategic Interactions in Science and Technology Networks: Substitutes or Complements?
candidates.title_2: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution
candidates.mechanism_1: An agent's position in a collaboration network determines their productivity. Higher network centrality increases output through strategic complementarities with connected agents. Activity in one domain (scientific) enhances productivity in another domain (technological), but this effect is asymmetric - the reverse direction shows no detectable influence.
candidates.mechanism_2: Strategy distributions evolve through selection (performance-based survival), innovation (mutation), and environmental perturbation (external shocks). Individual agents adapt using local signals while population composition shifts based on relative fitness. Two-layer adaptation - individual learning plus population-level evolution - determines whether strategies persist, collapse, or form coalitions.

candidates.title_2: Low-Dimensional Interaction Spaces Impose Geometric Constraints On Collective Organization

candidates.mechanism_2: When effective interactions among system components compress into low-dimensional interaction space, global organization is governed by geometric constraints rather than detailed dynamics. Low interaction dimensionality imposes upper bounds on number, separability, and robustness of collective organizations. Many macroscopic organizations are excluded a priori even when locally-compatible interactions exist, shifting explanation from generative mechanisms to structural impossibility.

candidates.title_1: Dimensional Peeking for Low-Variance Gradients in Zeroth-Order Discrete Optimization via Simulation
candidates.title_2: Unveiling Scaling Behaviors in Molecular Language Models: Effects of Model Size, Data, and Representation
candidates.mechanism_1: Lift sampling granularity from scalar perturbations to equivalence classes (control-flow paths). Multiple parameter values following same code path share gradient information, reducing variance without introducing bias. Information-per-simulation increases by reusing structural similarities in discrete optimization landscape.
candidates.mechanism_2: Scaling behavior depends jointly on model capacity, training data volume, and input representation structure: different representations yield different scaling exponents, making representation choice as critical as model size for performance.

Coherent many-body response creates effective nonlinearity through collective mode coupling. Weak individual interactions amplified by collective dynamics generate strong wave mixing.
